Title: Rana Daggubati: I had failed Class 10, but that did not discourage me from following my dreams
Content:
You had once said that you were a confused kid. Now, do you feel that phase in your life was instrumental in what you have become today?

Tell us about your love for visual effects ( VFX )?

What’s your trick to wade through negative thoughts?

Do trolls affect you?

Things you value most in life…

Who are your favourite stars in Sandalwood?

Your Bengaluru connect…

A look at actor-producer Rana Daggubati ’s journey is bound to be inspiring. Especially for the many students who are grappling with exams this season. During his chat with us, Rana tells us how he overcame academic setbacks to find his true calling. Excerpts:I had failed Class 10, and it obviously felt like a huge set back at that time. Sadly, that’s how we are conditioned to think — if we don’t do well in our studies, it’s the end of life. But amid the failure and all the confusion it led to, I sat back and tried to understand what I really wanted to do in life. And I realised that I wanted to pursue a career in the performing arts, particularly in movies. Of course, there was a lot of uncertainty during the initial phase, but now when I look back, I feel that I did the right thing.I am fascinated with movies like Star Wars. It was my dream to bring VFX to Indian cinema. Even though I was not good at studies, I loved computers and technology. In fact, my career began at a VFX company. Cut to films , I always felt that epic tales can be portrayed in a spectacular way via visual effects. More than technology, VFX is an art form that I find very intriguing.Like everyone else, I, too, had my share of ups and downs in life — be it in terms of my emotions or my health. But, overall, I think I have been fairly solid as an individual. My personal goals have kept me motivated throughout. I wanted to make really cool films, and that aim is bigger than my personal struggles. There were times when I was depressed and had negative thoughts, but I managed to overcome that by constantly focusing on my dreams.Trolls don’t affect me at all. I don’t care about what they say.Relationships. I feel that people should make an effort to ensure that they are consistently in conversation with people they value.I am a huge fan of the late Dr Rajkumar. Currently, I am working on Hiranyakashyap and for reference, I keep going back to his 1983 film Bhakta Prahlad. I have also known his son, Puneeth Rajkumar for a long time, and enjoy watching his films. Among independent films, I really liked Lucia. With KGF, Yash has managed to reach a milestone that we probably did with Baahubali and The Ghazi Attack .My sister lives in Whitefield, so I keep coming to Bengaluru. It’s a very young city, and that’s an endearing aspect.

Title: The Thayir Sadam Project’s new track is about the lack of peace in the pursuit of excellence
Content: The next track from The Thayir Sadam Project — comprising Bindu and Ambi Subramaniam Mahesh Raghvan and Akshay Anantapadmanabhan — will see the band collaborate with a 16-year-old pianist. The track, titled Never Sleep, sees the band perform with Vishwajeet Avinashilingam , who won a music competition recently. Ambi says, “It is always exciting for us to work with young musicians, because they have a different take and a fresh perspective when it comes to music. Vishwajeet is a pianist and has been influenced by jazz music. So, we wanted to do something different that suits Vishwajeet and our style. While Never Sleep is in The Thayir Sadam Project signature style, it has a lot of jazz influence.”The track, he adds, is different from what the band has attempted so far. The song has two distinct sections — a virtuosic segment, which is instrumental and a melancholic, intense segment, which has been sung by Bindu. “It’s an intense take on what children go through to excel in any field. The lyrics are about excellence and no peace of mind. It’s an interesting take on the issues that youngsters go through. This is something very different from what we usually perform, so it’s a first for us as well,” says Ambi.Vishwajeet, who is also working on his own compositions, says that working with The Thayir Sadam Project has been fruitful and has given him an insight on how the music industry works. “This is the first time I have collaborated with professionals and it felt phenomenal. The band’s take on music and how we introduced two different genres to create a new sound was a great experience,” he says.“The track is about issues that youngsters go through and I could relate to it on a personal level. Not just the lyrics, but the emotions and the vibe that the track eludes... I could understand what we were trying to convey. I’m also at a stage where I’m trying to strike a balance between my studies and my music,” he says, adding, “When youngsters listen to Never Sleep, they will be able to relate to the message that we are trying to convey through music.”

Title: As a woman, I’m proud that even at 40, I have a career: Isha Koppikar
Content: With a project as huge as these, there is always hope that it would see the light of the day. There is AR Rahman’s music, Sivakarthikeyan sir, and the production house is well-known… so, actually, the chance of this project not materialising was grim. I wouldn’t say I was disappointed (over the delay), but I believe in God’s timing, and know that whatever happens, happens for a reason. And it has happened at the right time now. 2020 is looking to be a great year for me.I really regret that. Being from Bombay, it is really difficult to come and settle here. I couldn’t do that. Also, I started getting offers in Hindi.Not at all. I was absolutely convinced. It’s a femme fatale role, something that I’ve always been waiting for. It is full of action, and I love the Lara Croft kind of roles. I think I have that kind of a strong image and this role falls completely in my scheme of things. I always believe that there cannot be an effective protagonist without a strong antagonist. In this, Sivakarthikeyan sir is the protagonist and I am the antagonist. For me, it is a fantastic opportunity, especially an actress gets to play such a role opposite such a huge star.The response from fans and the industry people has been overwhelming. I received a lot of love even then, and that continues even now. Tamil Nadu has been very warm in welcoming me. I felt like I was back to my En Swaasa Kaatre and Kadhal Kavithai days when everybody around me would be talking in Tamil. I was just telling this to my director that while I’m very fast at learning languages, by the time I start picking up Tamil, it is time to go back home, to Bombay. And once I’m there, I have no one speaking to me in Tamil there. And the best way to pick up a language is by speaking it more than just hearing it, and who do I speak to in Tamil there? I’ve made it clear to everybody on this film’s set to speak to me in Tamil so that it’s easier for me. That said, this role doesn’t have a lot of dialogues. Eliza, my character, is an assassin, more like a machine. She doesn’t speak much, and her actions will speak louder than her words. That’s what Eliza is all about.I’ve been training in martial arts for 18 years. I first learnt Taekwondo and then Hapkido (a Korean martial art). When you are a martial artiste, you automatically exude that kind of confidence. You appear a certain way that normal people do not. I carry a do-not-mess-with-me demeanour, which comes from my 18 years of training. I think I’m a fighter, mentally. Nothing comes easy in life. I don’t come from a filmi background. My parents are doctors. Martial art, to me, is a physical way of training your mind. By practising it, you learn to deal with life — the disappointments, the struggles and the challenges. This automatically reflects in your demeanour. That’s why I think I’ve been getting about half-a-dozen cop roles in the last few years. And this role is strong in its own way. It is that of an assassin, completely negative and full of action.Martial arts is not just about fighting, it also trains your system. It makes you stronger. Things like running, jumping over something, being on a harness… normally, women refrain from doing these things. But they are no big deal for a martial artiste.Nooooo. We have a proper alien character.No. I am not here to make a career out of politics. I’m in it to do something that I genuinely want to do. Right now, there is no other agenda, like contesting in elections. It’s now more about helping people, women especially. This is one sphere where I feel our government is lacking.It’s not easy, but maybe we need to create small session trial courts, appoint good lawyers and have trials on a day-to-day basis when it comes to crimes on women. The punishments have to be with immediate effect. We need to get our law and order in place and ensure cases don’t drag on and on. It’s like people aren’t scared of anything these days. We are talking about a country whose holy scriptures talk about women as incarnations of Gods, and today, women are battling for their security. When we are talking about development in many spheres, I think this is the most important. Women should feel safe and secure. Otherwise, it positions the country in a very regressive way. Every woman should be educated. And every man should be taught to respect women. Unfortunately, from day one, the men are taught that women are somehow inferior, that they are meant to be indoors, that if a woman dresses in any other way, it is provocative. And the list goes on and on. We live in a country where such attitudes have been prevalent for centuries, so those have to change. And that might not happen overnight. In interior India, a girl is married off when she is 14 or 15. She is looked at as someone who is there only for procreation. But that’s not it, and we all know that. We have to teach that men and women are equal. That’s the first thing that has to happen. Even when we hurt ourselves, the first thing we say is ‘Amma’. Appa’s contributions are very important, but our instinct is to say Amma. And who is Amma? A woman, right? As a woman, I’m proud that even at 40, I have a career. I have a daughter, I’m taking care of my house, I run a catering unit, I’m into politics.It’s all about time management. It’s all about how much time you can give to each of these roles, and what is important at that particular moment. It’s open day at my daughter, Rianna’s school today, but I’m here, in Chennai. I am shooting for a film and I cannot ask them to stop the shoot for a day just for my personal reason. It is not right. So, I told my daughter’s teacher that I’d meet her when I’m finished with my schedule. You have to address the issue depending on its importance. If I had had a business meeting in Bombay that could have been pushed, I’d have attended to Rianna. It’s all about prioritising, and I think it’s possible.I’d say I’m both. I don’t believe in giving in easily. I’d say ‘no’ 75 per cent of the times. A child needs to understand that nothing comes easy. If you keep saying ‘yes’ to every demand of the child, by the time they grow up, it will not be easy for them to fight when facing odds.There is one more schedule in March, and the shoot will be done. But there are so many months of post-production work to be done that it would be like making another film.The team is fab. My director is very calm. I’ve never seen him get agitated or angry or shout. He is so paavam. He is like a detox therapy. Sivakarthikeyan sir is also very calm, very sweet and friendly. He knows that I love food; I’m very particular about my food, so he told me about a few places where I could get salads and stuff like that.I don’t know how to get in touch with him. I’d love to meet him. He’s a superstar now. I know!Not really. I respect and love the people I work with more for who they are in real life than for their professional side. What you are as a person is what matters to me.I met Arvind sir the last time I was here. In fact, it was on the same day I was interviewed by Chennai Times last year. I met him in the same dress I was wearing for the photoshoot. I had called him a couple of months ago as well, but because of our schedules, we couldn’t meet then. He had told me then, ‘The next time you are here, you better tell me in advance.’ I met him and his family for tea.

Title: Ramesh Aravind opts for a black and blue theme for this audio launch
Content: If you have been following actor-director Ramesh Aravind latest works on his social media page, you would have noticed a fun boomerang wherein the entire team is seen sporting similar T-shirts that also announce the date of the release of his latest film — Shivaji Surathkal . This enthusiastic team spread their energy further at a media gathering held to release the music album featuring the songs from this film recently. And guess what? The team stuck to co-ordinating their outfits at this do too. So the theme was all about black T-shirts and blue jeans, barring a few special exceptions.The music of this Akash Srivatsa directorial is by Judah Sandhy , who was not at the event. Produced by Rekha KN and Anup Gowda , the movie also stars Radhika Narayan Aarohi Narayan and Sukanya Girish in prominent roles. Glimpses from the audio launch…

Title: Our friendship is quite organic; we didn’t let the competition affect our bond: Shine Shetty
Content: Season 7’s winner Shine Shetty and second runner-up Vasuki Vaibhav’s energy, despite being swarmed with fans and acknowledging their congratulatory messages after the show’s conclusion, is infectious. Their camaraderie reminds one of friendships that has only been seen in iconic films. The duo dropped by our office recently and gave us a glimpse into their friendship — praising each other’s stint on the show and teasing each other about their (apparently non-existent) love lives. Excerpts:We had no idea. Our families had only advised us to not tarnish our reputation on the show (chuckles). Our only intention was to entertain people. Thank God, it worked out fine.As soon as we stepped out of the house, we were introduced to the huge legions of fans. Their support was unbelievable. After a movie or serial, people treat you on the basis of the character you play on screen. But in case of Bigg Boss, people love you for who you are. That’s the beauty of that platform. Apart from us feeling loved and pampered, our parents too got to feel like celebrities.Since my first film, I have harboured the dream of winning a Filmfare award. In the previous editions, too, I have always kept track of the nominations and winners. So, finally winning the award is exciting and a matter of honour. I was extremely happy when I got to know and glad that my mother received it on my behalf. It was a very proud moment. Although, I have to admit that I was a bit sad, as I couldn’t collect it myself.The winner should answer that...Our friendship was quite organic. We were clear that during tasks, we’d be competitive and would not let it affect our friendship.We have never been on the same team for a task. We would communicate though our eyes and convey how we need to support people in our respective teams, even if we don’t agree with them. At the end of each week, both of us had a debrief session called, ‘Vaarada Salahe’, where we would give each other feedback about our performance.In fact, when Vasuki’s mother was asked how she felt about me winning instead of Vasuki, she said, “It doesn’t matter; my eldest son has won.” That was so special. Even when she came to the house, she had told us that people refer to us as siblings.That’s because, I knew you’d win and I wanted a share your victory.Depends on what you mean by love...You should say no — they mean ‘mature love’.Mature love? Then, you say, yes.Well, if it is puppy love, you should admit to that, right?(Mediating the banter) If not love, how about a crush?In real life, if you meet someone, you can say you have a crush on his or her. But, in the Bigg Boss house, after completing tasks with your hair going askew, it’s absurd to tell someone that you have a crush on him or her.(To Vasuki) You tell me. Whatever you perceived, is what others would have perceived too (chuckles!). Actually, I am confused. I do not know if I had a crush or I got crushed.During the Rakshasa-Gandharva task, I felt like going home. I had to play Rakshasa and behave in a crude manner. That got to me. We had to throw onions as part of a task and I was really upset, because we were throwing away food. It was a tiring week and I wanted to go home.I never felt like going home, because I was mentally prepared. And, thankfully, there weren’t as many fights as there were in the previous seasons of the show.I regret the physical fights we had to get into during the Rakshasa-Gandharva task.The beauty of the Bigg Boss house is that whatever you do, there are no take backs; it is the real you. So, although I regretted some experiences, I eventually learnt a lesson from them.I really love Deepika as a good friend. We were in the same team while completing all the tasks. I respect her and think of her as a strong woman. When she suggested that I remove my beard, I took her advice and decided to trim it. I remember going to Vasuki and narrating the incident in excitement. That’s how the Shine-Deepu bond started.Bhoomi is very young. In fact, Chandana and Bhoomi are of the same age and I am older than them. They were playful, stubborn and had mood swings. But, we had a good time pranking them. After the show, I have often been asked about my equation with Bhoomi and I have no idea how to answer it.Even though Bhoomi and Chandana are of the same age, Chandana is very mature and took suggestions. And, thanks to her, all fans have started calling me Shinu.On the show, contestant Chaitra Kottur told Vasuki that she would love to wash vessels with him once they are out of the house. When we asked Vasuki about it, he said, “I have no idea why she had that weird aspiration. I guess, we should just wash some vessels and put an end to it. Chaitra, I am waiting.”

Title: Sakshi Agarwal poses for the shutterbugs at Seeru Premiere at Sathyam Cinemas
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

We couldn’t help but notice how some of our celebrities made understated fashion statements at a film screening recently. Don’t want to go overboard with ethnic wear? Opt for a cut work dupatta like Riya, or an angrakha-style kurta like Chandini. Want to add some drama on a regular day? You could go all out with animal prints and accessorise it with a men’s watch, like Sakshi Agarwal . Men can experiment like Jiiva , who pulled off a cutesy motif shirt. A lesson in casual dressing, this event turned out to be!

Title: I-League: Chennai stun Churchill Brothers 2-1
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Margao: Churchill Brothers FC suffered another reverse at home as Chennai City FC secured a 2-1 win in a I-League clash at the Nehru Stadium in Fatorda on Sunday.

Churchill controlled most of the proceedings but had themselves to blame in a dramatic game where all the action unfolded in the final 10 minutes.

With just five minutes left to be played, the teams were locked goalless and the organisers didn’t have any hesitation in announcing Churchill’s Glan Martins as the Man-of-the-Match. However, at the same moment it seemed Churchill’s world would come crashing down when Japanese Katsumi Yusa broke the deadlock for the visitors with a clinical finish. Substitute Lalkhawpuimawia, however, put Churchill back into the game as he equalised within two minutes.

The two-time former champions should have been content with a point but instead lacked concentration in added time which proved costly. Switzerland striker Jan Muzangu made the most of the situation and moved swiftly inside the box to score the match-winner with only a minute left to be played.

The 19-year-old who joined Chennai from FC Basel’s U-21 side scored his first goal in the league after four appearances and it could prove to be an important one in the resurgence of Akbar Nawas’ side.

It was Churchill’s fourth defeat in nine matches and they have now lost three of their six games at home. They have dropped to seventh in the standings with 13 points. Chennai’s second consecutive win helped them climb to the fifth spot with 14 points from 10 games.

The looked on to carry on the momentum after winning their previous matches. Captain Abu Bakr was back from suspension and gave stability at the back for the home side. Coach Bernardo Tavares made just one change to the team which defeated Neroca FC 4-1 at home.

Churchill had the edge right from the start and created several opportunities but none that troubled Chennai’s Spanish custodian Nauzet Gracia.

Dawda Ceesay whipped in a dangerous cross early on but it missed most of his teammates including Ponif Vaz, who was in an ideal position.

Glan Martins and Quan Gomes made desperate attempts to feed Ceesay and last season’s join top-scorer Willis Plaza , but the striker was heavily marked.

Before the half an hour mark, Socrates Pedro moved dangerously on the left and played a delightful one-two with Glan. The Portuguese winger found space inside the box, but his grounder missed the target narrowly.

Chennai were content with their defensive approach and showed very little intent to test rival goalkeeper James Kithan. They came closest before the break when they won a freekick at the edge of the box after Jovel Martins brought down Jockson Dhas. However, Adolfo Miranda’s left-footer hit the side-netting.

Churchill started brightly in the second session but were unlucky. Quan worked a set piece as Bakr headed towards Plaza but the Trinidad and Tobago forward saw his header hit the horizontal.

Chennai mostly attacked on the counter and in the 85th minute, Adolfo found Katsumi through for the opener. Churchill responded two minutes later when Lalkhawpuimawia headed in a cross from Poniz Vaz.

However, it was Muzangu who stole the limelight in added time as he dribbled past two rival defender and beat Kithan for the match winner.

Title: Vicky Kaushal promotes 'Bhoot: The Haunted Ship' posting a series of super handsome pictures of him on Instagram
Content: The trailer of Vicky Kaushal 's upcoming horror drama 'Bhoot Part One: The Haunted Ship' has received a lot of appreciation and love from the audience. Now, the actor has kick-started the promotions of the film over social media.Today, he posted a series of pictures while promoting the ghost-flick using his captions. The actor looked super handsome in a black jacket with tags on it, a grey t-shirt underneath the jacket and black cargo pants. Well, don't miss his sunglasses which perfectly complemented his look! He captioned the picture, "Knock Knock! .Who’s there? .Bhoo.... Bhoo who? .Bhoo-who-ooooot! 🧟‍♀️"Check out the posts here:Meanwhile, the film is helmed by Bhanu Pratap Singh and also stars Bhumi Pednekar and Ashutosh Rana . Backed by Karan Johar , Apoorva Mehta and Shashank Khaitan , the film will hit the theatres on February 21.On the other hand, Vicky will also star in 'Karan Johar's 'Takht', Sardar Udham Singh biopic directed by Shoojit Sircar and Sam Manekshaw biopic helmed by Meghna Gulzar

Title: Thankfully I wasn’t made ‘Komolika’ in Yeh Rishta: Pankhuri Awasthy in Lucknow
Content: Akash.Wadhwa@timesgroup.comIn Lucknow to meet her family, actress Pankhuri Awasthy made the most of her time and went Ganjing. "I used to come here so often during my school days," recalled the ' Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai ' actress. "Even though I used to pass this restaurant in front Halwasiya Market, I never got the opportunity to taste the famous burger here. But when I had it today, it was so yummy and filling," she added. All set to make her Bollywood debut with the movie 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan ', Pankhuri sat with us for a brief conversation and discussed about turning negative in her last serial, her Bollywood debut, motherhood and more...Pankhuri Awasthy enjoying burger at Marksman in Lucknow (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui In 2018 I got married to Gautam (Rode) and that whole year passed by in settling only. I did a few episodics, music videos and commercials but didn't do a proper daily. The year 2019 started on a great note as I got the confirmation for my film 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan'. The months of September, October and November was blocked for the film and a few months back only I got this call for 'Yeh Rishta...' It was a perfect three months cameo which was fitting in best with my schedule. I met Rajan (Shahi, the maker of the show) and my character sketch in the serial was really beautiful. Though my character in the show turned a bit grey later, initially it was planned to be really positive. The best part is that because of the popularity of the track, it was extended from three months to eight months.My track in the serial was really liked by the viewers and so it was extended, to which I was initially sceptical. I didn't intend to play a negative character as before this I had never played one. For the last 15 episodes, I was made to sit with the creatives who explained to me why they were turning my character negative. For me, I was not initially convinced as this is not something which I was told. But then the makers tried to convince me, although I wasn't. I had a choice to quit the show but then I didn't want to leave the show mid-way that too on a sour note. Then they gave an emotional angle to my negative shade and thankfully didn't make me a Komolika in the serial.Pankhuri Awasthy in Lucknow (BCCL/ Farhan Ahmad Siddiqui)Towards the end of my character, I actually liked the grey shade in my character. My comeback depends on what the makers want to do with the show and my availability at that point of time. If I like my character sketch, I might return to Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai.Coming back to the most talked about thing these days for you, your movie Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan. How did that happen for you?I had auditioned for the movie long time back but then at that time I didn't know the complete concept of it. I was in Kerala when I got a call confirming my character. Even though it is my Bollywood debut, I didn't mind playing just a character in it. I am there in the film throughout. But if you talk about meaty scenes and dialogues, they are not that much. I know an Ayushmann Khurrana film is an ‘Ayushmann’ film but then it is also about the ensemble cast. In an Ayushmann film even the character with the smallest screen space leaves an impact. Take for the example of Bala, you will have recall value for all the characters. But if an actor does a typical hero-heroine film, the ensemble cast might not have that much of role, but in his movies it is guaranteed.Motherhood is going to happen eventually, but not in immediately in the near future. Initially we had planned for parenthood after two years of our marriage, which we will be completing soon. But career wise I have just started and I am very career oriented. Having said that, I always think there is a specific time for one to start the family. You can't expect to be 70 and your kids in their teens. You can't enjoy that then. I want to be there for my kids and understand them and not be too stubborn. And the older we get, the more difficult it is for us to change. Plus, I am just 28 right now, so I have a lot of time.— Akash.Wadhwa@timesgroup.com

Title: Punjab: Man facing dowry charges commits suicide
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Representative image

PATIALA: A 52-two-year-old man on Sunday allegedly committed suicide in Patiala by consuming some poisonous substance two days after he appeared in the police station to join the investigation in a case related to dowry and breach of trust.

The deceased has been identified as Jagdish Singh . The police have booked Jagdish's distant relative Lalit Kumar, 38, of Dhamoli village, an employee in private industry, under sections of abetment to suicide at Banur police station.

Deceased's family alleged that Lalit Kumar somehow developed an extramarital affair with Jagdish’s 21-year-old unmarried daughter. They added that around six months ago Lalit’s wife came to know about the illicit relations and got annoyed and then she managed to get registered a case of dowry against her husband Lalit, his family members and Lalit’s relatives including Jagdish and his 21-year-old daughter.

“Only two days before committing suicide Jagdish has appeared before the court and also visited the police station as he joined the investigation in a case registered against him under sections of dowry. He was a distant relative of the complainant and it seems that he was wrongly implicated in this case by my predecessors but we are investigating into the matter thoroughly,” Banur police station SHO Subash Kumar said.

“Lalit’s wife earlier also landed in a mutual compromise in dowry case after both Lalit and Jagdish’s daughter had assured her not to continue their illicit relations. However, both of them allegedly continued their affair and this remained the bone of contention between the Lalit’s wife and Jagdish and his family. Jagdish appeared before the court in this case and I had assured him to get him justice. He has written this in his suicide note too. We are verifying all the facts and will also probe that how a case of dowry was registered against him despite the fact that his involvement does not seems to be”, said Subash Kumar.

Deceased’s relative Amarjit Singh , who lodged the complaint, said, “I was stunned how the police had falsely implicated Jagdish and his daughter in a dowry case. He was already facing economic distress. Jagdish was twice married and both his wives died in the past.”

Title: Oscars 2020: Here's when you can watch the 92nd Academy Awards in India live

Meanwhile, the red carpet will start at 5 am IST. It will be live on the official Twitter handle of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (@TheAcademy).Films like 'Once Upon A Time in Hollywood ', 'Parasite', '1917', 'Jojo Rabbit', 'Joker', 'Little Women' and 'Ford v Ferrari' are running the race for the Best Film Award.Also, following what has worked for the Academy last year, Karey Burke, president of ABC Entertainment, has announced that the 2020 Oscars will have no host. Title: Kilometre scheme in Haryana: Jhajjar GM flags off five buses
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

CHANDIGARH: Amid protests by Haryana Roadways staff , Jhajjar GM flagged off five buses under the per kilometre scheme on Sunday morning.

Much to the surprise of many, soon after bus started the ignition, an employee of Haryana roadways laid down before the buses. Later more employees joined him and raised the anti-roadways and the anti-government slogans.

All this went on for an hour before police removed the agitating employees and allowed the buses to go out of the bus stand.

Notably, after hiccups and controversies, the Haryana transport department has agreed to run buses under the per kilometre scheme. With these five buses, total of 90 buses out of the 510 have come out on the roads.

Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar has already ruled out the withdrawal of scheme, especially under the protests by Roadways employees.

Roadways employees are demanding withdrawal of buses as this has hit the state exchequer.

Notably, in a bid to bail out the contractors who have bought the buses two year ago, the government had decided to put the buses on road in case they agree to the terms and conditions of government.

Title: Gargi students allege ‘hundreds’ entered campus, molested many; to hold protest
Content:
File photo

NEW DELHI: Students of Delhi University 's Gargi College called for a protest march on Monday after allegations of sexual assault and molestation during the college's fest on February 6 went viral on social media.Hundreds of men allegedly entered the campus during a music performance and groped and molested the women, the students alleged. They demanded answers from the administration on the security setup in the college."Gargi has been a home, a safe space for us. We exist here. Every year, the administration fails to provide basic safety to us. Year after year, it turns a blind eye to the safety of students at the fest. We need you to come forward, show solidarity, and raise your voice against the draconian administration," the students said in their statement.They demanded answers from the administration on "why so many people were allowed inside the college without proper passes and why people were allowed to enter post 4.30pm and what the cops were doing."According to a student who was allegedly molested on that day, the college's fest 'Reverie' was a three-day event with the final day open for men to enter the campus with a valid pass. "There were supposed to be separate gates for the entry of men and women. However, when I reached the campus from my home nearby, I saw men entering from the gate where only women were allowed. Many were allowed even after 4pm and without their IDs or passes being checked," said the second-year student.She added that the crowd had increased so much that "there was no space to move. I was groped thrice and those men laughed at me. Even then, I had to stand there for 40 minutes before I could move towards the cricket ground to be with my friends."Students alleged that men were seen walking around with their shirts unbuttoned; some were even shirtless and masturbated in front of female students. Some alleged that there were cases of medical emergencies. "I saw several female students who had fainted, lying on the ground unattended, while many were experiencing anxiety and panic attacks."The students alleged that when they approached the principal, she refused to pay heed to their complaints.Speaking to TOI , Promila Kumar , principal of the college, however, said: "The fest was open for men and women of Delhi University and we had ample security, bouncers, and staff members. We had a special arena for women but some chose to be out with their friends. The whole gathering happened peacefully and we did not get any complaints at the college." Kumar added that she and other officials were also on duty and they did not get any official complaint.In Video: Gargi college students allegedly molested inside campus during college fest

Title: Ravidas Jayanti: Punjab minister urges followers to join hands to protect Constitution
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

JALANDHAR: Stating that the constitution of India drafted by Dr BR Ambedkar was in unison with the philosophy and teachings of Guru Ravidas, Punjab Social Justice minister Sadhu Singh Dharmsot, while addressing the state-level function here to mark Ravidass Jayanti , called upon people to join hands for protection of the Constitution as a real and befitting tribute to the Guru.

"Some divisive forces are hell-bent upon destroying the basic spirit of the Indian Constitution, which needs to be checked by one and all especially by the followers of the Guru Ravidas. Latter preached the ideology of egalitarian society which was incorporated in the constitution for safeguarding the interests of weaker sections of society. It is the bounden duty of all the followers of the great Guru to safeguard the constitution and to protect the rights enshrined in the constitution for the weaker and the underprivileged sections of society," he said while addressing the function at Guru Ravidas Bhawan.

Meanwhile, the minister said that following efforts by the state government, Union government released funds worth Rs 600 crore for the post-matric scholarship scheme. "These funds were pending for the period of 2014-17 but now the state government has disbursed this amount to the colleges and sent the Utilization Certificate (UC) to the centre," he said while assailing the union government led by BJP for backtracking from implementing this pro-poor welfare scheme initiated by the former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: How eroding share of Congress may further boost AAP
Content:
File photo

NEW DELHI: A further decline in the prospects of Congress in Delhi, though not unexpected, seems to be powering AAP ’s success, as has been predicted by various exit polls. Most polls forecast zero seats for Congress though one has given it four, with a vote share of 8.8%.In 2015, Congress had a vote share of 9.8%. Psephologists don’t seem to believe that the party can match even that figure this time round. Unlike BJP, which mounted an aggressive campaign, the grand old party was largely missing in action. AAP claimed that a major chunk of late voting had gone in its favour even though BJP maintained that the reality was quite the opposite.Congress’ loss is being seen as AAP’s gain, as any vote-split would have helped BJP make deeper inroads.Sources said among a few constituencies where Congress ran a strong campaign were Kasturba Nagar, Gandhi Nagar, Seelampur, Mustafabad, Badli, Sultanpur Majra, Chandni Chowk, Hari Nagar, Dwarka, Kalkaji, Sangam Vihar and Kondli. However, with party bigwigs conspicuous by their absence for most of the campaigning, it was left for the candidates to fend for themselves. To their credit, many of them conducted door-to-door meetings and made extensive use of social media, besides holding small public meetings on their own, the sources added.But for most parts, the campaign failed to generate a lot of excitement. While BJP and AAP ran high-octane campaigns, Congress adopted a laid-back approach, with not many senior party functionaries hitting the ground in support of its candidates. In the last week of electioneering, several star campaigners, including Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and ex-PM Manomohan Singh and chief ministers of Chhattisgarh and Punjab CM, did address public meetings, but it all appeared to be too little too late.“Congress doesn’t appear to be very strong this time. When it was in office in Delhi, the party carried out a lot of development work,” said Hiten Sharma, a voter at Chanakyapuri. The party, too, chose to harp back on its past record, often invoking the tenure of three-time CM, the late Sheila Dikshit.While some candidates blamed the delay in distribution of tickets for the lackadaisical approach, others claimed that there was a lack of coordination from the central office. A candidate, requesting anonymity, said that the party had failed to back the contestants on the ground. While the more resourceful candidates could still power their campaigns, the newcomers fought lone battles.In contrast, sources in AAP said, the party had managed to project itself as an alternative to people who previously voted for Congress. “A large chunk of Congress voters shifted to AAP across various assembly segments. It will significantly increase our vote share and lead to the party breaking its own record of 2015,” claimed an AAP functionary. In 2015, AAP had won 67 of the 70 assembly seats.Even though Congress failed to match the electioneering blitzkrieg of AAP and BJP, the chief of the party’s Delhi unit, Subhash Chopra, claimed they would surprise everyone with their performance when the results finally came out. In Video: Delhi polls: AAP guns for EC over final voter turn-out figures

Title: Coronavirus: PM Modi writes to Xi, offers help; masks go off export-ban list
Content:
File photo

NEW DELHI: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has written to Chinese President Xi Jinping expressing solidarity with China over the coronavirus outbreak and also offering assistance in facing the challenge from the epidemic which has already killed more than 800.The PM offered condolences at the loss of lives due to the outbreak, government officials said, and also conveyed appreciation for facilitating evacuation of Indian citizens from Hubei province. Chinese ambassador Sun Weidong had briefed foreign secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla on Friday about Chinese efforts to deal with the crisis.Sun had sought a meeting with Shringla immediately after the latter took over as foreign secretary last month. “Received condolence letter from Indian PM Narendra Modi to Chinese President Xi Jinping regarding nCoV outbreak in China. Appreciate friendly message and kind support by Indian government. Look forward to further cooperation and confident the epidemic will be brought to an end soon,” the Chinese ambassador tweeted.Significantly, as Modi wrote to Xi, the government also removed surgical masks and gloves from the list of banned export items. After the coronavirus outbreak, the government had banned export of protective gear used to ensure safety from airborne diseases.India has also assured China that there was no ban on travel to India for Chinese or other foreigners based in mainland China and anyone wanting to travel to India only has to apply afresh for a new visa.In Video: Coronavirus outbreak: PM offers assistance to China

Title: Madhya Pradesh: In MP, 4.5 lakh Swachh toilets disappear in Rs 540cr scam
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Representative image

BHOPAL: Call it the vanishing-toilet scam. More than 4.5 lakh Swachh loos have been flushed into oblivion in Madhya Pradesh , along with the Rs 540 crore it took to build them.

The toilets may never be found — though the administration has GPS-tagged photographs of each of them — but the government aims to recover every paisa spent on them. It’s a reminder of the toilet door scam unearthed in Guna district in 2017, where the iron doors of 42,000 toilets were built 10kg lighter, leading to siphoning of crores.

The ‘vanishing’ toilets were supposed to have been built — at least on paper — between 2012 and October 2018. But they don’t exist. Officials believe that the photographs submitted as proof of Swachh toilet construction were actually clicked elsewhere, perhaps at neighbours’ homes as proof of money spent.

Some villagers blew the whistle in Betul’s tribal Lakkadjam panchayat and complained to officials. A probe quickly found that four Swachh beneficiaries — Chaitram, Ram Kishore, Kansraj and Shambhudayal — were not even aware that toilets have been built in their name. On government records, not only do their homes have toilets but the government portal has pictures of them before loos as well. Officials found that all four were photographed in front of a neighbour’s toilet.

“A detailed probe was conducted in Lakkadjam panchayat, and the complaints were found to be true. For these toilets and other similar anomalies, a recovery of Rs 7 lakh was imposed on the accused. They appealed against the recovery order, but the penalty was upheld. Once recovery is done, we will initiate action under IPC . I have ordered investigation of all the other work done in the panchayat,” chief executive officer (CEO) of Betul panchayat ML Tyagi told TOI.

It set alarm bells ringing and the panchayat and rural development department has since identified 4.5 lakh such missing ‘paper toilets’ across the state. In monetary terms, toilets worth Rs 540 crores are missing, said an official.

“In 2012, a baseline survey was conducted and 62 lakh above-poverty-line households without toilets were identified in the state. On October 2, 2018, construction of all these toilets was complete. But to ensure that these toilets are actually present and 100% complete, we conducted a survey and physical verification using 21,000 volunteers. During this survey, around 4.5 lakh toilets were found to be missing,” deputy director of Swachh Bharat Mission (Rural) Madhya Pradesh, Ajit Tiwari, told TOI.

A second physical verification is under way. “It is being conducted by district-level officers. We hope it will be complete in a couple of months. Then, we will have a cleaner picture of the numbers of Swachh mission toilets. Our objective is to ensure that the toilets or assets built by the government are actually present,” said Tiwari. The data will be put in public domain so that the beneficiaries can check for any anomaly, he added.

“There were two processes of making payments. Panchayats were provided money upon completion of toilets in households, or the government transferred Rs 12,000 to beneficiaries’ accounts once they built the toilets. In both cases, it is clear where the money went. So, people responsible for the missing toilets will have to build them for real, or the face music. The sole objective is to ensure 100% completion of the target identified in 2012,” Tiwari said.

Asked how the scamsters beat technology since Swachh toilet photographs are geo-mapped, Tiwari said: “The GPS is accurate up to 6 metres. Most probably, pictures of toilets within 6 metres were uploaded in the name of the beneficiaries or pictures of toilets built prior to 2012 were uploaded. Things will be clear once the second survey is complete.”

Title: Punjab: Probe finds basement dug beyond permissible limit
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

The preliminary investigation found that the basement of the adjoining plot was dug up beyond the sanctioned d... Read More

MOHALI: A day after a triple-storey building with a basement collapsed in Sante Majra village on Kharar-Landran road here on Saturday, the preliminary investigation found that the basement of the adjoining plot was dug up beyond the sanctioned depth. As a result, it exposed the foundation of the adjacent three-storeyed building, leading to its collapse.

The builder also did not inform the Kharar municipal council before digging up the basement. Secondly, the owner of the building that collapsed failed to produce requisite structure stability report for erecting two mobile towers atop his property. “These matters will be investigated once the debris is removed,” said deputy commissioner Girish Dayalan.

He said as per preliminary inquiry, while the building plan was sanctioned by Kharar municipal council, the builder did not intimate the MC about starting the basement digging work, which is mandatory. He said it was alleged by the builder that the contractor started digging without his consent and dug more than the sanctioned depth, which could have resulted in the collapse of the adjacent building.

Dayalan said, “A thorough report will be prepared by an additional district magistrate-level officer and all parameters, including structure stability report, permissible limit for digging of basement and foundation strength of the building, will be considered. The report will be submitted to the chief minister. But one thing is clear that the earth was removed beyond permissible limit, which exposed the foundation of the three-storey building.”

He said out of the two mobile towers, permission for one was granted in 2016. Officials of Kharar MC said they were checking their records for permission to the second.

Title: Purnia gears up to celebrate 250th anniversary
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

PATNA: Purnia district is set to celebrate its 250th anniversary in the coming week. A host of events will be organised on February 14 and 15 to mark the occasion.

The district administration has appealed to all residents to decorate their houses and business establishments with lights and rangolis and also participate enthusiastically in the events to be held on the occasion of anniversary celebration. The best three decorated premises would be awarded by the district administration.

Purnia DM Rahul Kumar on Sunday said that a special memorial march, ‘Smriti Yatra’, would be taken out in the district headquarters as a token of tribute to the first civil surgeon Dr Pikachi, who revolutionised the healthcare system in 1770, by undertaking horse rides to remote areas for treatment of ailing people. An exhibition of his services will be also organised near the old dilapidated house of Dr Pikachi.

The district administration has sought public opinion through the social media as to what more events could be organised to add value to this celebration. With the appointment of George Ducrail as its first supervisor collector, Purnia got the status of a district on February 14, 1770, said the DM.

A festival named as ‘Purainia Mahotsav’ being organised during the anniversary function will have a flower show competition for encouraging people to grow flower plants in and around their houses. “Gardening helps to maintain the ecosystem,” said Rahul.

Other events slated for the occasion include free screening of two films— Dangal and Panchlat—hockey and football competitions, cultural functions and panel discussion by experts on various topics.

Abhiyan Kitab Daan, another initiative launched on January 25, as a part of the anniversary celebration to build up libraries in 2,255 government schools with enrolment of six lakh students, has also evoked good response and over 2000 books donated by locals reached the officials till Saturday.

“We want to make it a historic event and the ‘Donate Books’ initiative aimed at collecting at least one lakh books by March end for developing libraries in all schools, will boost school education in the district,” the DM said.

Title: Withdraw notification on NPR in state, Gopinath urges Nitish
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

PATNA: Former Kerala cadre IAS officer Kannan Gopinath, who is campaigning against implementation of National Population Register (NPR) and National Register of Citizens (NRC) in the country, on Sunday urged CM Nitish Kumar to withdraw the notification regarding implementation of NPR in the state, as NPR and NRC are inter-related and their implementation would result in deprivation of citizenship to lakhs of people. While state assemblies of four states have already adopted resolutions against the implementation of CAA, NPR and NRC, the Bihar government has already issued a notification regarding the implementation of NPR in the state. Though the ruling NDA partners – JD(U), BJP and LJP -- had supported the CAA Bill, Nitish had expressed his reservations about the NRC, but maintained that the NPR could be implemented, pointing out at the same time that the questionnaire regarding NPR should be revised and four to five questions listed in the questionnaires needs to be scrapped. “NPR is the first step towards NRC. If you are not implementing NRC, then what is the point in implementing NPR in the state?,” Gopinath asked, adding that rich and resourceful people would not be affected by NRC and NPR, but the poor would definitely be affected

. TNN

Title: PU to reclaim land from NIT-P for development of own campus
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

PATNA: Even as Patna University (PU) has, of late, decided to reclaim its land, National Institute of Technology-Patna (NIT-P) does not appear to be in a mood to vacate its present campus.

The decision to ask the NIT-P administration to return the university’s land acquired by it was taken by the PU syndicate at its recent meeting held under the chairmanship of vice-chancellor Rash Bihari Prasad Singh. The syndics felt the necessity of reclaiming its land in view of the expected loss of the portion of its land on account of the ongoing Metro project. A good portion of PU’s land lying north of Ashok Rajpath is likely to be taken over by the said Metro project and, hence, the university, which is already facing acute space crunch, would be unable to complete many of its campus development schemes, they observed.

The syndicate further pointed out that since NIT-P has already been allotted 125 acre land adjacent to IIT at Bihta to develop its new campus, there was no justification for it in continuing to function from its present campus.

It may be mentioned here that as early as in 2004, the erstwhile Bihar College of Engineering (BCE) was upgraded to NIT-P by the Union HRD ministry. Then, the college was running as a constituent unit of PU. Ultimately, the entire college was handed over to the union government following an MoU signed between both the parties. It was then decided that NIT would be shifted to a new large campus having about 300 acres of land. But, after much persuasion, the state government sanctioned land to the institute in 2012.

However, due to delay in acquisition of the allotted land at Bihta, the NIT-P started the expansion of its existing campus with the sanction of necessary funds from the union government. The construction of additional hostels for boys and girls, which include G+10 and G+5 buildings, separate residential blocks for teaching and non-teaching staff went on its Ashok Rajpath campus. Also, the construction of separate electronics department, students’ activity centre, nanoscience department, auditorium and new incubation centre is going on.

Hence, handing over PU’s land along with this huge infrastructure, including the newly constructed buildings, would not be so easy for the authorities, said a senior faculty of NIT-P. Moreover, development of a new full-fledged campus at Bihta will take its own time.

Meanwhile, PU VC, when contacted, said the university is seized with the problem of space and it would soon write to both the state government and the chancellor, requesting them to expedite reclamation of its land occupied by NIT-P. The university is contemplating to set up some of its study centres on this land, he said.

Title: Experts welcome Rs4,614cr budgetary allocation for ECR
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

PATNA: Technical experts and senior railway officials have welcomed the allocation of Rs 4,614 crore in the Union Budget for East Central Railway (ECR) for the 2020-21 fiscal. The budgetary allocations, they feel, will expedite various railway projects in the region.

Describing the allocations as growth-oriented, former railway chief engineer G N Sahay said of Rs 4,614 crore allocated to ECR, it is expected that a big chunk of Rs 3606 crore would be spent on laying new lines, track doubling and gauge conversion work.

“Railways is keen to introduce semi high speed trains in Bihar for which the ECR has got a major share of Rs 580 crore for track renewal work,” Sahay said, adding Union finance ministry has, however, remained silent on the issue of laying a third line between Mokama and Buxar to cope with huge traffic flow on this route.

The ECR had got budgetary allocations of Rs 3,696 crore in 2017-18 fiscal, Rs 4,014 crore in the 2018-19 fiscal and Rs 4,560 crore in 2019-20 fiscal.

ECR’s chief public relations officer (CPRO) Rajesh Kumar said the thrust would be on development of railway network in the state. “Allocation of Rs 838 crore for the Koderma-Ranchi and Koderma-Tilaiya new rail lines, a stretch of about 257km, will give a boost to both passenger and goods traffic. Hajipur-Sugauli new rail line, a stretch of about 148km, has also got of Rs 1,006 crore in this Budget,” he said.

The CPRO said the Kiul-Gaya track doubling work would be completed within the stipulated time as the Budget has allocated Rs 280 crore for the project.

Similarly, adequate funds have been allocated for track doubling work on Hajipur-Bachwara (72km), Muzaffarpur-Sugauli (100km), Samastipur-Darbhanga (38km), Patratu-Dhanbad (291km), Ramna-Singhrauli (160km), Karaila-Sakhtinagar (32km), Daniya-Ranchi Road (25km), Garwaha Road-Ramna (33 km) and Gomoh-Khanudih flyover route, the CPRO said.

“The ECR has also been allocated Rs 250 crore to complete pending gauge conversion work on Sakri-Loukha Bazar (206km) and Jayanagar-Bijalpura-Bardibas in Nepal (69 km) routes,” Kumar added.

Title: Power engineers’ body splits over Feb 11-12 strike
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

PATNA: The Power Engineering Service Association (PESA) is divided over the 24 hours’ symbolic strike called on February 11 and 12, as a section of engineers of Bihar State Power Holding Company Limited (BSPHCL) as well as its subsidiary companies has decided to stay away from it.

An urgent meeting was called by engineers, civil engineers, officers of the accounts, HR and IT departments of power companies on Sunday to discuss the issues behind the strike and recent clarifications by Union power minister RK Singh and BSPHCL CMD-cum-principal secretary of energy department Pratyaya Amrit that there was no move to privatise power holding companies.

Around 300 officials from various circles of state attended the meeting and showed disappointment towards the alleged arbitrary orders of PESA general secretary Surendra Kumar.

Vinod Kumar, executive engineer, said Surendra is involved in self-motivated acts in the name of PESA. “This has tarnished the image of not only PESA but the entire electrical workers and caused mutual disenchantment among the ‘power’ family,” he said and added: “We have already asked the engineers to submit their applications if they want to join the strike. Alternative arrangements will be made as we will not let the common people suffer due to the illegal strike called by PESA.”

Meanwhile, PESA general secretary sacked chief engineer Dilip Kumar of PESU, superintendent engineer Chandrashekhar and executive engineer Vinod Kumar from the union for not supporting the strike. Some other members also left the union.

When contacted, Dilip said PESA is not a registered body, so they are going to form another union. “In our next meeting, we will hold the elections of the new body. We will not be the part of strike,” he said.

Chandrashekhar said Surendra has created a state of fear and confusion in the ‘power’ family by spreading unfounded rumours of privatisation of power companies.

However, Surendra told this newspaper that it was an illegal meeting convened in the name of BSPHCL and the CMD. “We will hold our strike from 6am on February 11 till 6am on February 12. When the PESA already exists, how can they form another union in the same name,” he said.

Title: Experts lay stress on conservation of manuscripts
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

PATNA: Library scientists and conservation experts here on Sunday highlighted the importance of manuscripts in preserving the intellectual heritage of mankind and stressed the need of their preservation and conservation.

Addressing the participants of a five-day workshop on ‘Preservation and Conservation of Manuscripts’, organized by Patna University (PU) library in collaboration with the National Mission for Conservation of Manuscripts they narrated the details of various traditional and modern techniques of conservation.

Reserve Bank of India (Pune) chemist Sarvesh Kumar Singh said that initial treatment and protection of manuscripts from harmful agents like dust, moisture and moths would save them from decay and enhance their life. He presented the details of chemical techniques of preservation of manuscripts.

National Museum coordinator Kriti Srivastava enumerated different methods of conservation of manuscripts and answered the questions asked by the participants. He opined that the government must initiate necessary steps for conservation of all our manuscripts lying in precarious condition in different parts of the country.

National Mission for Conservation of Museum conservator Archana Gehlot apprised the participants with various forms of manuscripts and proper use of chemicals for their preservation.

PU vice-chancellor Rash Bihari Prasad Singh said if due attention is not given for conservation of manuscripts, there is every possibility that our cultural heritage and nation's collective memory available in the form of manuscripts may disappear. He pleaded for digitization of all rare and valuable manuscripts for the benefit of future generation.

PU library incharge Rabindra Kumar welcomed the guests. Deputy librarian Ashok Kumar Jha proposed the vote of thanks. The workshop will conclude on Monday.

Title: Kashi celebrates Maghi Purnima, Ravidas Jayanti
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

A shobha yatra being taken out in city

Varanasi: Lakhs of devotees thronged ghats along the Ganga and took dip in the river on the occasion of Maghi Purnima on Sunday. Meanwhile, several religious events were held to mark Ravidas Jayanti celebrations.

Devotees started reaching the ghats from the city as well as the adjoining districts for the auspicious occasion of Maghi Purnima from early hours of Sunday morning. The areas near the ghats were heavily crowded and the arrival of devotees continued till late afternoon.

Meanwhile, celebrations of 643rd birth anniversary of Sant Ravidas started in and around the city since morning hours. Religious processions and tableux were taken out on roads. After congregating at Maidagin, a major religious procession moved to Seer Gowardhanpur area via Bansphatak, Godowlia, Sonarpura, Shivala and Lanka.

The festive mood was evident in seer Govardhanpur area since Saturday evening. The women groups could be found celebrating the occasion by dancing and holding other events near the temple and Ravidas Park area. Another major celebration was evident at Ravidas temple at Bhaisasur Ghat area.

Title: Two die after two cars collide, catch fire in Amreli
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

The accident happened in Laliya taluka

Rajkot: Two persons were burnt to death and four others injured when two cars they were travelling suffered a head on collision and caught fire in Amreli district on Saturday night.

Police said the accident occurred near a food factory between Saladi and Lalavadar villages of Liliya taluka in Amreli district.

Fire tenders from Amreli fire brigade rushed to the spot to douse the fire. “The deceased were identified as Punja and Mehul. Those injured in the accident identified as Kana Mevada (28), Vijay Lambariya (22), Vijay Mevada (22) and Paresh Siroliya (25) were rushed Amreli Civil Hopsital,” said an official from Liliya police station.

While Punja and Mehul were driving the ill-fated cars, the injured were occupants of one of the cars. The injured said they were returning to Liliya after attending a marriage function in Saladi.

Title: 1,100 participate in cyclo walkathon at Ankleshwar
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Bharuch/Surat: More than 1 ,100 cyclists participated in the fifth edition of cyclo walkathon that was organised on Sunday morning at Ankleshwar.

Ishwarsinh Patel, minister of state for youth, sports and culture along with Bharuch MLA Dushyant Patel flagged off the cyclo walkathon.

The cyclo walkathon which is organised every year by Ankleshwar Bicycle Club is getting overwhelming response.

“The number of participants are increasing each year. The participants spread the message of fitness, health, saving fuel and protecting environment by reducing fuel emission,” said Naresh Pujara, convener of Ankleshwar Bicycle Club.

The initiative taken at Ankleshwar has become an inspiration for other smaller towns. “Many leading industrialists are also going to their factory on bicycle. It is truly a laudable initiative,” said Ishwarsinh Patel.

The participants completed 11 km route that covered Gattu Vidyalaya, police station, ESIC hospital, Jaldhara and returned back to the starting point.

Eleven bicycles were sponsored by various corporates. These bicycles will be put up at Jogger’s Park against which users will be charged a token fee. “This will help those who do not have bicycle and want to use it,” said Pujara.

Title: Kolkata Metro: East-West Metro’s Phoolbagan station ready for final nod
Content:
The interior of the Phoolbagan Metro station

TimesView We must push for the Phoolbagan and Sealdah stretches to be operational as early as possible. This will benefit thousands of commuters and make the project more viable.

KOLKATA: East-West Metro’s Phoolbagan station is now ready for an inspection by the commissioner of railway safety (CRS), which is likely to be carried out sometime this month. The 1km Phoolbagan stretch will be added soon after the inauguration of the first phase of East-West Metro on February 13.The East-West line’s first phase was originally planned till Phoolbagan, but delay in building the station has made the inaugural run shorter. The authorities feel that the truncated operations can be somewhat viable if services are extended to Phoolbagan, where the underground station has been built and a 1km tunnel has been dug till Sealdah . The stretch till Salt Lake Stadium , which is ready to run, is elevated. From there, a ramp at Subhas Sarovar leads the tracks under ground.The now-complete Phoolbagan station has all the advanced features of the six elevated ones that dot the Salt Lake stretch. Alongside the large staircase, there is a ramp for the differently abled which connects to an elevator to the non-paid area on the concourse level. Another elevator from the paid area goes to the station 18m below, where passengers will take the BEML-make trains. On the safety front, the 229mx25m station has passenger screen doors, CCTV cameras, neon signs, digital information display boards, ticket-vending machines, automatic fare collection gates, customer care booths and a hi-tech station control room. Tactile paths have been laid at entry and exit points for visually impaired passengers.Apart from being the city’s first underground Metro station to be built in 25 years, Phoolbagan station is also the first of the six underground stations of East-West Metro that is ready to function. Though Howrah Maidan , Howrah and Sealdah stations are structurally complete, they cannot start functions until the last leg of tunnelling between Esplanade and Sealdah is complete.Work for the Phoolbagan station started in 2011 with a 2013-14 deadline. It ran into an obstacle due to delay in site handover. Kolkata Metro Rail Corporation, the implementing agency of the Rs 8,575 crore East-West line, received the last tranche of land only in 2014.Other features at the station include three pairs of staircases, leading to the three entry-exit areas on either side of the crossing. ITD-ITD Cementation, contracted to build the Sector V-Esplanade leg of the East-West Metro, could, however, accommodate only one opening on the Narkeldanga side for want of space. The marble-floored platforms measure 140mx12m, 30m shorter than the North-South ones to accommodate the six-coach rakes instead of the eight-coach ones.Another interesting feature is the concrete beam jutting out of the overhead exhaust duct that will ensure that cool air circulating in the platform does not escape into the tunnel. The tunnel, too, is unique. Since it will be cut off from the stations by screen doors, ducts have been built to maintain ventilation. They will suck out hot air given out by the moving train and direct it through the ventilation shafts on either side of the platform. “The station will change this crucial north-eastern point of Kolkata,” said B L Saha, a Phoolbagan resident for four decades.

Title: Cyber sleuths arrest woman lecturer for breaking man’s engagement
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

SURAT: The cybercrime police arrested a woman lecturer of a college in Thara in Banaskantha district on Saturday for allegedly conspiring to break the engagement of a businessman.

The lecturer Dolly Shaha, a resident of Thara, shared fake details about the businessman to his fiancée on Instagram chat. After seeing the details, the girl called off the relationship with the businessman in August last year.

Shah had planned to break the relationship since her talks of engagement with the complainant businessman did not work out in the past. The businessman deals in auto parts.

The businessman, who lives in Adajan, had approached police after getting to know that someone had tarnished his image on the social media, which led to his engagement being called off. Even as the crime was committed last year, the complaint was lodged on Friday.

“The accused lecturer told police that she defamed him to take revenge. In the past, her and the businessman’s family had been discussing their arranged marriage. As first step, their engagement was planned but due to some unknown reason it was cancelled,” said a police officer of cybercrime police station.

Later, Shah started keeping a watch on social media updates of the businessman. When she came to know that he had got engaged to another woman, she decided to break their relationship.

“She created an Instagram account with fake details,” said police.

According to the complaint, Shah sent messages to complainant’s former fiancee on Instagram that the businessman lived with a woman from Maharashtra at his home when his parents had gone to Rajasthan . Following these messages, the businessman’s engagement was cancelled. The businessman was not aware who was behind the messages hence he approached police.

Title: Rebel Foods targets $1 billion valuation
Content:
(Representative image)

BENGALURU: Rebel Foods , which runs cloud kitchens like Faasos , Oven Story Pizza and Behrouz Biryani , is eyeing a valuation of about $1 billion as it looks to mop up a new round of funding of $100-150 million. The move comes as investor interest in the space ramps up, said three sources familiar with the development.Rebel runs over a dozen virtual restaurant brands where it sells directly through its own application besides platforms like Zomato and Swiggy. The new funding follows less than six months after the Mumbai-based company raised its previous round of $125 million, which valued it at $525 million.The contours of the deal are still being discussed and the numbers could change, said the sources. “There has been inbound interest over the last few months to invest in the company, which has prompted Rebel to raise the new round,” said one of the sources mentioned earlier.The fresh round could see existing backer Coatue Management — a US-based hedge fund — invest about $50 million, while the remaining capital is raised from other new and existing investors. Financial services major Goldman Sachs and Indonesian ride-hailing giant Gojek were some of the other new investors in Rebel, while its early backers include Sequoia Capital India and Lightbox Ventures.Japan’s SoftBank Vision Fund has also recently expressed interest in the company again, though it is not clear if those talks have progressed. SoftBank had also held discussions with Rebel last year, but these did not fructify as its portfolio company Oyo was also making an aggressive push in the category. Although recently, Oyo has been cutting costs and has laid off significant staff in its kitchens business, according to reports.An emailed query to Rebel Foods CEO Jaydeep Barman and Coatue did not elicit a response till the time of going to press. A SoftBank spokesperson “declined to comment on market speculation”.What is attracting global interest in the category is the increasing spends on home delivery with the proliferation of online food delivery applications. The US has seen companies like DoorDash and UberEats come up, while in China, Meituan Dianping has become one of the most valued listed internet companies in the country after Alibaba and Tencent.The cloud kitchen segment has also attracted entrepreneurs like Uber’s Travis Kalanick, who started City Storage Systems, which is creating an infrastructure for kitchens, after his exit from the ride-hailing company. Kalanick had also picked up a small stake in Rebel last year. Rebel has seen its growth explode over the last few years. The company is expected to close the year ending March 2020 with total revenues of Rs 600-650 crore and is currently doing monthly revenues of Rs 75 crore, according to two sources mentioned earlier. Rebel already has about 325 cloud kitchens across India and has also started overseas expansion into Southeast Asia, Middle East and Europe.

Title: Coronavirus: Hong Kong gems show cancelled
Content: SURAT: Diamantaires of Surat and Mumbai eagerly await the world’s largest gems and jewellery fair which takes place in Hong Kong in March as it spurs the demand for polished diamonds and jewellery. However, coronavirus epidemic in China has cast a dark shadow over the prospects of the diamond industry, reeling under recession for a long time now. Hong Kong International Diamond, Gem & Pearl Show and Hong Kong International Jewellery Show, which were scheduled in the first week of March, have been postponed until May due to the outbreak of coronavirus.Industry sources said over 300 Indian diamond and jewellery companies from Surat, Mumbai, Antwerp and Hong Kong participate in the gems and jewellery events in Hong Kong. The events attract tens of thousands of international buyers from across the world, which give a fair idea to diamantaires about consumer demand.Nilesh Bodki of FamAsia Limited, a diamond company based in Hong Kong, said, “The March events in Hong Kong are a gateway to consumer demand in the world. Since the shows have been cancelled due to coronavirus, it is a wait and watch situation in the diamond industry. This is the year’s first largest jewellery event to spur the diamond demand in the world. Unfortunately, India’s diamond industry is going to be a big loser due to coronavirus.”Hitesh Patel, managing director of Dharmanandan Diamonds, said, “From Hong Kong shows, we get a fair idea on consumer demand and we manufacture the goods accordingly. For Surat, these are important shows as majority of diamonds displayed are of 30 cent to 1.50 carats.”Industry leaders have predicted that coronavirus epidemic in China is set to reduce exports of polished diamonds to Hong Kong by over 20%. Hong Kong is second largest polished diamond export market for India after the US, with annual exports to the tune of over $8 billion. Aniruddha Lidbide, diamond industry analyst, said, “The diamond industry was hoping to recover after facing challenging 2019, but cancellation of Hong Kong show is going to have a huge impact in the coming months. Predicting consumer demand has become difficult when China is hit by coronavirus epidemic.”

Title: Headless, PCB unable to proceed against local bodies
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Kochi: For the past several months, the Kerala State Pollution Control Board (KSPCB) had been at the forefront of disciplining the local bodies, including Kochi corporation, for their failure to adhere to statutes of Solid Waste Management (SWM) Rules, 2016 by imposing heavy penalties under the polluter pays principle.

But with the resignation of board chairman Ajit Haridas on January 22, ironically over the enthusiasm he had shown to take penal action against erring local bodies, the entire exercise has hit a wall. According to sources, the board would not be able to take further action in the notices issued unless a new chairman is appointed.

“Only the board chairman has powers to issue directives under Section 5 of the Environment Protection (EP) Act. So further action on the notices issued by the board is not possible,” said KSPCB member secretary Sreekala S. Board chairman was vested with powers to issue notices as per a central government notification.

The National Green Tribunal (NGT) had recently permitted PCB to recover environment compensation to the tune of Rs 1.12 crore from Kochi corporation. The board had issued show cause notices to the local body after it failed to set up leachate treatment at Brahmapuram and biomethanation plant, which is mandatory as per the SWM Rules, 2016.

Sreekala said the board has so far issued directive to pay compensation only to Thrissur corporation. “For all other local bodies, we have issued only show cause notices, asking them to inform why penalty should not be imposed for violating SWM Rules,” she said. Board has slapped a fine of Rs 4.5 crore on Thrissur corporation.

Thiruvananthapuram corporation had obtained a stay against the PCB directive for compensation from the Kerala high court in December 2019. PCB pulled up the corporation for not complying with the directives of the State Level Monitoring Committee (SLMC).

“We are hoping that a decision on appointing a new chairman would be taken without further delay,” said Sreekala. According to PCB sources, the list of candidates for selection of chairman from which Ajit Haridas was chosen is still valid. “Government can choose the next eligible candidate from this list as it is only a year old,” said an official.

The SLMC appointed by NGT is expected to submit their report to the tribunal this week. “The absence of PCB chairman would affect further action against local bodies . NGT may have to issue directives in each case to overcome this,” said SLMC chairman Ramakrishna Pillai.

Title: Protests at 11 places in Biharsharif
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

BIHARSHARIF: Inspired by protest at Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, small groups of men and women have been staging dharna at 11 places in Biharsharif in Nalanda district against Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) for over fortnight.

It started from Kashi Takiya on January 13 and gradually spread to Shekhana, Kaghzi Mohalla, Sohdih, Katrapar, Khasganj, Kolsum Tola, Kantapar, Dairapar, Sakunat and Chandpura localities in the town.

Salma, an undergraduate student from Kashi Takiya said CAA is not that bad but together with NRC it will prove disastrous for the poor and illiterate Muslims and people of all other communities. Sheeren of the same locality said women come at the protest site after 6pm and leave around 10pm every day.

Rosy Khatoon (50) of Kolsum Tola said most of the women protesters have come out from their houses for the first time.

A 84-year-old advocate, Iqbaluz Zafar of Katra, said the protest marches and sit-ins are spontaneous and being organized under ‘Desh Bachao Samvidhan Bachao’ banner. He said a number of non-Muslims also visit different protest sites to extend their support. He said women mostly sit at protest sites between 6 to 10pm and candle light marches are organized on daily basis in their localities.

Political leaders and social activists, including Upendra Kushwaha, Pappu Yadav, Tariq Anwar, Kannan Gopinathan and others have addressed them so far.

Title: Woman suspects husband to be victim of hit and run case
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Palanpur: A woman has lodged a complaint with Prantij police expressing her suspicions that her husband Aswini Kumar Kantilal Chavda, ( 39), ), who died on January 29 , 2019 , may have been a victim of hit and run.

In her complaint, Nisha Chavda said that her husband who was working with Karanj police station in Ahmedabad was killed in an accident on January 29 that took place near Sukhad village road.

Prantij police have registered an FIR based on her complaint.

Superintendent of police, Prantij, Chainya Mandlik, police have formed two teams under police inspector MD Champawat and PSI BD Rathod to probe into the woman’s complainant. Cops are questioning the woman and other family members of the deceased as well as those suspected to be involved in the alleged crime.

Meanwhile, cops also have doubts on the wife and has kept her under the scanner because she is allegedly involved in extramarital affair with one Manish. Police suspect that Manish and his driver Nilesh Kumar may have staged the crime. Further investigations are on.

Title: Live-the-faith msg: Churches to reach out to people
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Kolkata: It is not enough to read religious texts and voice out gospels, unless one is able to translate them into daily action. This message will be highlighted at parishes of the Roman Catholic Church from Tuesday.
