Title: Pak shelling claims life of Raj jawan in J&K, funeral today
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Jaipur: A jawan from Rajasthan was killed in cross-border firing in J&K’s Poonch district on Saturday.

Naik Rajeev Singh Shekhawat from Luhakana village in Virat Nagar tehsil of Jaipur district was killed during shelling along the Line of Control (LoC) in Degwar sector. He was posted with Rashtriya Rifles.

His mortal remains are expected to reach his village on Sunday night. He will be cremated with full military honours on Monday.

Shekhawat, 36, is survived by wife, son and parents.

Luhakana former sarpanch Bhawani Singh said, “Shekhawat was my junior in school and always wanted to join the army. His father is also an ex-serviceman. The family has lost their only son and the sole bread winner. He had come to the village last month. The family is inconsolable and it is an extremely difficult time for them. His son does not even understand what has happened.”

Chief minister Ashok Gehlot and his deputy Sachin Pilot condoled the death of Shekhawat.

“I salute braveheart Naik Rajeev Singh Shekhawat of Luhakana Khurd, Rajasthan, who made the supreme sacrifice on the Line of Control in Poonch. My deepest condolences to the bereaved family,” Gehlot said on his Twitter handle.

Title: On launch mode: Technopark firm develops blockchain sat
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Though blockchain technology , with its decentralized approach, offers a solution to security issues , a lot of firms have concerns in using the technology due to restrictions in storing information in systems that are connected to the internet. To bring a solution to such users, a Technopark firm is set to enter a new territory — the space.

Technopark firm Accubits Technologies is gearing up to launch ‘ChainSat’, the world’s first enterprise blockchain satellite. ChainSat is a low earth-orbit satellite, weighing 12kg, and it can establish an enterprise blockchain ledger that can enable a secure transactional network for financial and government firms, which have privacy as a key concern.

Four-year-old Accubits Technologies has planned the ChainSat as a network of eight satellites. In the first phase, the team is planning to launch its first satellite by January 2021. “During the first phase, we expect a communication delay of 16-19 minutes. With the commissioning of the second phase consisting of the remaining satellites, we will get real-time data. The second phase is expected to be ready by the end of 2022,” said Jithin V G, co-founder and CEO of Accubits. With the support of Space Park, a state government initiative, the firm is in touch with various space agencies such as SpaceX, Antrix and French space agency CNES for the launch.

Explaining on the need for a satellite, Jithin said that the existing communication channel —the internet— could not assure the security demands of various firms.

“After that initial blockchain boom from 2015-18, we saw that the wave was receding. Most of the financial institutions and government firms have certain compliance policies which restrict them from storing information on public-facing servers or systems that are connected to the internet. ChainSat aims to fix this problem by facilitating an off-grid network for blockchain transactions. With this, users in the enterprise blockchain network can access the decentralized ledger through direct satellite communication,” he said.

Accubits’s client list includes JPMorgan Chase, Vista Bank NASA, United States Geological Survey, United States Postal Services, among others. It has provided land registry on blockchain for Dubai land department.

Title: Ramesh Jarkiholi: Must thank DKS for my rise, says Ramesh Jarkiholi
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Belagavi: In comments that raised eyebrows, Ramesh Jarkiholi, who quit the Congress and joined the BJP and who took oath as minister last week, said his brother Satish has a bright future. The two siblings have rarely seen eye-to-eye — at least in public — in recent times.

He also trained his gun on Congress leader DK Shivakumar, sarcastically thanking the Congress MLA for his meteoric rise. “Had Shivakumar not stood against me, I would not have emerged as a tall leader in the state. I must thank him,” Ramesh said.

The Gokak MLA said Satish of the Congress, the most politically-savvy of the five Jarkiholi siblings, would reach “the top” in his political career. However, he advised him “to inculcate patience and adopt strategies”. “He should make his moves at the right time as timing is very important in politics,” Ramesh said.

He also urged Satish to keep his supporters happy. “Many of his followers are disappointed with his leadership because he does not extend a helping hand to his own people. In the present political climate, people do not endorse a leader who only talks about Buddha and Basava,” Ramesh said.

Ramesh took a dig at Lakan, the youngest sibling, saying, “Lakan speaks ill about me most of the time. He does not understand much. But we brothers are one when it comes to family. We are united when it comes to family matters, but when it comes to politics, we are at loggerheads.”

Title: Matchmaking seminar for HIV+
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Nashik: Nearly 250 HIV-positive people took part in a matchmaking seminar organised by city-based non-profits and the District AIDS Prevention and Control Unit (DAPCU) on Sunday.

NGO Yash, which was one of the lead organisers, has been conducting the event for the past 12 years. So far, it has been able to match 57 couples.

Sunday’s event saw participation from across the state and beyond. “I run my own matchmaking centre in Malegaon. I am looking for a bride who understands my condition. That is why I came here. I hope to find someone interesting today,” said Ramesh*.

Relatives too turned up to look for matches for their loved ones. “I am looking for a suitable bride for my younger brother,” said one participant’s sister. “He lives in Nagpur and he found out he had HIV last year. He is very young and handsome. We hope to find a girl who will understand my brother’s condition,” she said.

Registration started at 8am and the main programme began with a round of formal introductions. Then the participants sat in a circle to introduce themselves to each other. This round ended with a lunch, but personal meetings went on until 5 pm.

“It doesn’t end here,” said Ravindra Patil, secretary of the Yash Foundation. “The prospects will meet each other a couple of times. Once satisfied, they will inform us and we will arrange a medical counselling before their wedding. It is not easy to have such a condition and still hope to have a happily married life. The NGO's objective is to give them a platform,” he said.

The event also featured success stories by two couples who had met each other through Yash. Both couples today have children who have tested negative for HIV/AIDS.

“Our parents did not want us to get married as they were worried our children will have the same health issues. But we took that brave step and today, we have a beautiful daughter who has tested negative. Medical science has progressed,” said Rachna*, one of the participants who shared her success story with others at the event.

Title: Kivale man duped of Rs 48k on promise of selling puppies
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Pune: Buying puppies online from two unknown persons cost a 25-year-old man from Kivale Rs48,000 last month.

When Vishal Sambhaji Shinde did not get the puppies on the promised day, he started pursuing the fraudsters for his money. The suspects threatened him that one of their relatives was an officer with the state police and refused to return the amount. Shinde on Saturday lodged an FIR with the Dehu Road police against the duo. “I am a member of a WhatsApp group for dog breeders in the state. On January 18, I had posted about a requirement for a beagle puppy. A day later, a person called me and said he was willing to sell a pair of beagle puppies for Rs20,000. He even sent me the photographs of the puppies,” Shinde told TOI.

Shinde said the person told him to transfer the money online, following which he would deliver the puppies from a private bus in the evening. “Believing him, I transferred the money and told him that I would be waiting at the Pune end of the Pune-Mumbai expressway to collect the delivery,” he said.

Shinde said the suspect also gave him the contact details of his ‘relative’ who wanted to sell a puppy of Siberian Husky breed. “After talking to the ‘relative’, I transferred Rs28,000 more. He told me he would bring the Siberian Husky along with the beagles,” Shinde said.

When Shinde did not get the puppies by the evening, he contacted the person. “He said there was some problem with the bus and would be delayed. However, despite waiting for a long time, I did not get delivery and realised that I had been duped,” he said.

Shinde said that when he posted the incident on the Whatsapp group, six people, including a woman, got in touch. “They told me that the same person had duped them as well,” he added.

Title: Corpn replaces 45,000 sodium vapour lamps with LED lamps
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Coimbatore: The city corporation has replaced close to 45,000 sodium vapour street lamps with LED lamps in the last seven months and is expected to change the remaining lights within a month.

The corporation had decided to replace 58,878 sodium vapour lamps with LED lamps at the cost of Rs 81 crore. The replacement work commenced in July after checking the quality of the procured lights twice through third party, a corporation source said.

“We have almost completed the replacement work and it is only a few thousand is pending. It is expected to be completed within February. About 10,000 to 12,000 lamps would be kept in stock as buffer and would be used in case of emergency,” the source added.

The source said that the corporation is also planning to install controllers for every ten of lamps and it in turn would be connected to a dash board which would be closely monitored by the officials.

Explaining that the installation of controllers is expected to be completed in another couple of months, the source said that once the installation work is completed, the issues like faulty bulb could be identified even before public raises a complaint about it.

The decision to change the bulbs in older corporation areas was taken after witnessing the positive result of installing LED lamps in 40 added areas of the corporation limit. The LED bulbs had helped the corporation to conserve power by 42%. At present, the corporation is paying more than Rs 20 crore per annum as electricity bill and over Rs 9 crore to maintain street lamps.

Title: National war memorial gets more footfalls
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Pune: The wreath-laying ceremony and light and sound show at the Southern Command’s National War Memorial have created a buzz among the Puneites.

Over one lakh people from all walks of life, including school students, have visited the memorial in the last one year.

Army officials said the response to the wreath-laying ceremony and light and sound show is steadily increasing in the city. As per the army records, on average, 8,000 people visit the venue every month. The command had been organising the ceremony for the public for the last three years.

“Interaction between school students and soldiers is one of the crucial aspects of the event,” a senior army officer said.

Aakash Pandey, a software professional who had visited the memorial with his family recently, told TOI, “I had never attended a wreath-laying ceremony before. It is important that everyone visits the memorial to understand the finer nuances and the importance of this military function.”

Besides the ceremony, the memorial houses ammunition gallery, brief write-ups about the history of the Southern Command and its contributions in several wars and operations over the years. The Dakshin Maharashtra and Goa Sub Area (DMGSA), which is the local military authority, started conducting special light and sound show for the public a few months back.

“The light and sound show concept is new for people and, therefore, the event sees a large participation. On January 26, the crowd was such that several people had no place to even sit,” said another army officer, who is involved in the planning of the ceremony.

Title: Delhi polls 2020: With record turnout, women bridge gap with men
Content:
Long queue at Nawada on February 8 (File photo)

NEW DELHI: More women stepped out of their houses and voted in this election than ever before. This was revealed by the voter turnout data shared by the Election Commission on Sunday. Not just that, the usual gap between male and female voters also narrowed to a record minimum of 0.07%.Delhi Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) Ranbir Singh said 62.62% men and 62.55% women cast their votes on Saturday, while the total voting percentage was 62.59%.Though there was a dip in this year’s voter turnout compared with the record turnout of 67.1% in the 2015 assembly polls, in absolute terms the number of people who voted actually went up from 89.3 lakh to 92.5 lakh this time, an increase of 3.1 lakh or 3.5%.While the number of male electors went up from 49.9 lakh in 2015 to 50.7 lakh this year (an increase of 76,361 or 1.5%), the number of eligible women voters who exercised their franchise jumped from 39.3 lakh in 2015 to 41.7 lakh this time, an increase of 2.4 lakh or 6.1%.The gap between male and female electors who voted was 1.7% in 2008, which dipped to 0.8% in 2013 and increased to 1.1% in 2015. It has now reduced to a record low of 0.07%.In 2015, when Delhi witnessed a record voter turnout of 67.12%, the voting percentage of men was 67.63%, while 66.49% women exercised their franchise. In 2013, the overall turnout was 65.63%, comprising 66.03% men and 65.14% women. However, compared with the 2019 Lok Sabha election in May 2019, the voting percentage increased by 2.4%. According to the EC , 60.2% electors had cast their votes to elect seven Lok Sabha members in Delhi last year.In absolute numbers, of the 1,47,86,382 voters (81,05,236 men, 66,80,277 women and 869 third gender) eligible to vote in the 2020 polls, a total of 92,54,843 exercised their franchise. This included 50,75,662 of the 81,05,236 men and 41,78,841 of the 66,80,277 women.The final data released by the Election Commission showed that five assembly segments registered the highest voter turnout. They included Ballimaran (71.6%), Seelampur (71.2%), Mustafabad (70.5%), Gokalpur (70.5%) and Matia Mahal (70.4%). Three of these constituencies fall in North East Delhi parliamentary constituency , while two are part of Chandni Chowk Lok Sabha seat.Interestingly, of these five constituencies, Ballimaran, Seelampur and Matia Mahal are dominated by Muslim voters, while Mustafabad also has a sizeable population of the religious minority group.The reserved constituency of Gokalpur had witnessed the highest turnout of 74.2% in the 2015 election. Seemapuri, another reserved constituency, which witnessed the second-highest turnout of 73.3% in the 2015 polls, has dropped to sixth position with a turnout of 68% this time.The five assembly segments that registered the lowest turnout this year included the usual laggard, Delhi Cantonment, which witnessing 45.4% people voting this time. It was followed by New Delhi (52.1%), Mehrauli (56.5%), RK Puram (56.6%) and Nangloi Jat (56.7%). Of these five constituencies, three have a sizeable population of government employees and are part of New Delhi parliamentary constituency. The other two have a sizeable rural population.There is a considerable variation between the data released on Saturday night compared with Sunday’s because the final computation took time, said Singh.

Title: 35-year-old man impregnates 16-year-old girl, arrested
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: A 35-year-old daily wage labourer was arrested on Sunday for impregnating a 16-year-old higher secondary school girl in the city. The girl is a Class XI student of a government school.

According to a police officer, the issue came to light during a medical camp that was conducted at the girl’s school recently. “During the camp, she inquired about the menstrual cycle and told doctors that she was having menstrual problem. The minor girl was sent to the Coimbatore Medical College and Hospital , where doctors found that she was six months pregnant,” the officer said.

The girl’s parents lodged a complaint with the Perur all-woman police on Sunday. During inquiry, the girl told police that M Vellingiri alias Rajan, of Nehru Street at Ettimadai, had dragged her to an isolated place and raped her on June 16, 2019, when she went out to attend nature’s call in an open space.

“He also threatened her and forced himself on her on several occasions,” the officer said quoting the victim.

The Perur all-woman police subsequently booked Rajan under Sections 5 (1) (j), (2) (n) and 6 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (Pocso) Act and arrested him on Sunday afternoon. Further investigation is on.

Title: Pakistan presents 60 from India as kabaddi world cup team
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

AMRITSAR: A group of about 60 circle kabaddi players, said to be mostly from Punjab, has created a controversy by participating in Pakistan’s first 'kabaddi world cup 2020', which is being played in circle format, without any official permission or clearance by the Union sports ministry.

India has denied sending any team to Pakistan and the Amateur Kabaddi Federation of India (AKFI), the apex body for the sport in the country, too washed its hands off the row by saying that it had not authorized any player to go to Pakistan.

This is the first time Pakistan is hosting the event. The poster of the tournament shows participation by 10 countries, including India, Australia , UK, Canada , Germany, Iran , Kenya, Sierra Leone and Azerbaijan. The eight-day tournament was inaugurated at Punjab Stadium, Lahore, on Sunday and matches will be played in Faisalabad on February 12 and 13 and in Gujrat, which is in the country’s Punjab province, on February 14. The final will be held on February 16 in Lahore and the prize money for the victorious team is 1 crore Pakistani rupees.

The circle format is popular mostly in Punjab. The national-style kabaddi is recognized by Indian Olympic Association and also by the Olympic Council of Asia and is used in the Asian Games . Tournaments like the Pro-Kabaddi League and 'Kabaddi World Cup' are played in the same format.

A circle kabaddi team has 10 players and four rolling substitutes are allowed during a match, so ideally a team would not comprise more than 14 players. The invitation to 60 Indian players has created a controversy in Pakistan too. Pakistan Amateur Circle Kabaddi Federation (PACKF) blamed the Pakistan Sports Board (PSB) for "importing 60 Indian players to adjust them in teams of other countries, who have not sent official teams.'

Sources told TOI on Sunday that as many as 58 Indian kabaddi players had crossed over to Pakistan from Attari international border in two batches on February 6 and 7 and were received by Pakistan Punjab’s minister of sports, Rai Taimoor Khan Bhatti.

All the Indian players purportedly had gone to Pakistan on their own but Pakistan, according to these sources, was projecting them as the ‘Indian team players.’ There are no details available about how these kabaddi players financed their trip when they did not get any permission from AKFI.

Punjab Kabaddi Association president Sikander Singh Maluka admitted he knew that some kabaddi players had gone to Pakistan to play in a tournament but denied they were part of any official team. He said Pakistan had invited many kabaddi players in Punjab and even asked him to attend the tournament "being organised in the name of Guru Nanak Dev."

However, There is no information available in Pakistan about the event being organized as part of celebration for Guru Nanak Dev’s 550th birth anniversary.

Reiterating his allegations about a ‘scam’ linked to the invitation to such a large group of kabaddi players from India, Muhammad Sarwar Bhatt, the PACKF secretary general, told TOI that he had filed a writ petition against PSB in the Lahore high court a few days ago.

“This is a big fraud being committed in the name of kabaddi,” claimed Bhat.

The Lahore high court had summoned the PSB director to furnish records and began an inquiry into the reason for inviting 60 Indian players for the tournament, Bhatt said, adding that “the PSB president has been directed to furnish records on March 12.”

AKFI administrator, retired Justice SP Garg told TOI that the body didn’t support the unauthorized Pakistan visit by the kabaddi players and said that “legal action may be taken against these players.”

Title: Bhujbal directs civic chief to carry out Phalke memorial repair work
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Nashik: District guardian minister Chhagan Bhujbal on Sunday visited the city-based Dadasaheb Phalke memorial park and expressed disappointment over its poor condition.

Following this, Bhujbal directed municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game, who was also present during the visit, to carry out the repair work of the memorial at the earliest.

The kerb stone on either side of the road has collapsed, in many places the tiles on the steps and musical fountain are broken, water proofing, tiles, doors, windows, passage and steps of the food court need immediate repair. The toilets on the premises of the park also need repair.

In the beginning, the park used to witness good footfall, but people have turned their back to the site for the many years due to municipal corporation’s negligence.

Last week, Bhujbal had visited pending tourism projects like Boat Club, adventure sports complex near Gangapur dam. And on Sunday, he paid a sudden his visit to NMC’s Dadasaheb Phalke Memorial that was constructed in 2001.

Confirming the news, a senior NMC official said the civic administration has already extended the contract of the present contractor for maintaining cleanliness at the memorial park.

“We are also in the process to develop Phalke memorial on our own and necessary financial provision will be made in the civic budget for the financial year 2020-21,” he said.

The memorial park, situated around 13-km and spread over 29 acre, displays an eloquent version of Phalke’s works along with a beautiful garden in its courtyard.

The NMC intends to develop the entire complex in order to converting it into a tourism hub. The civic body wants to develop parks with recreational, leisure, entertainment, green zone, garden facilities and bird park for tourists at the site through a private agency on public-private-partnership (PPP) basis.

Title: IFS officer suspended on charges of ‘financial irregularity’
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Haridwar: The forest department has suspended Indian Forest Service ( IFS ) officer AK Gupta for his alleged involvement in illicit felling of pine and sal trees and illegal extraction of resin worth Rs 5.63 crore in Champawat during his stint as district’s divisional forest officer (DFO) between 2010 and 2016.

The suspension order, signed by principal secretary of Uttrakhand forest department Anand Bardhan, came out on Friday. The officer, the order said, has been attached to the headquarters of forest department under the head of forest force now, and would be given 50% of his salary as per the IFS service rules for next 90 days. The order, a copy of which is with TOI, reads, “Charges of financial and administrative irregularity against AK Gupta as DFO of Champawat has turned to becorrect as found out in the investigation conducted by Sanjiv Chaturvedi.”

Earlier in September 2017, an audio clip of Gupta had gone viral suggesting his involvement in the case. Thereafter, an investigation was launched and within two months, whistle-blower IFS officer Sanjiv Chaturvedi submitted his probe report which found Gupta guilty. Subsequently, a three-member committee was set up by the then head of forest force to ascertain charges against Gupta.

The committee also concluded that Gupta had allegedly sold trees worth lakhs in connivance with smugglers and villagers in his six-year tenure.

It was noted that a well-networked gang used to operate on the behest of a legitimate license provided by Gupta during his years of service in Champawat.

Notably, the Forest Management Plan of the state does not allow any permit for pine felling for market sale. However, Gupta allegedly issued ‘rampant permits’ in violation of the rules, the report says.

Incidentally, AK Gupta had even approached the high court and had requested the HC to stay on in Champawat. Interestingly, he had won the case.

When asked about the delay in ascertaining charges against Gupta, principal secretary of forest department Anand Bardhan told TOI, “Departmental processes take time. The suspension order comes after several clearances.”

TOI tried to contact AK Gupta but he was unavailable for comment.

Title: Governor lauds TN govt
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Salem: The Tamil Nadu government’s efforts have resulted in the highest gross enrolment ratio in higher education amongst all states in India at 49.3%, said governor Banwarilal Purohit.

Participating in the golden jubilee celebrations of Sri Vidya Mandir Association at Sri Vidya Mandir Higher Secondary School in Salem on Sunday, the governor said that the state government has opened new colleges, commenced new courses, invested in improving infrastructure, created more posts of teachers and filled teacher vacancies to make higher education more accessible and to enhance quality.

He also lauded the private sector for achievement of Tamil Nadu in academic arena.

“The contribution of the private sector for promoting the cause of education has also been commendable. Many philanthropic trusts have come forward to set up schools, colleges and universities in the state,’’ he said. Appreciating the educational institutions for laying stress in inculcating skills required for employment, the governor said that the students too are bright enough to expect the education system to equip and stir their creative side.

Title: Sarpanch, babus use fake death papers to embezzle govt funds
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Bhopal: By showing living people as dead on documents, a sarpanch and his accomplices of Kadhaiya Chhawar village embezzled Rs 49.85 lakh of funds under a government scheme.

On Saturday, Berasia police registered a case of forgery against eight people, including the village sarpanch, panchayat secretary, panchayat coordinating officer, nodal officer and four office-bearers of the panchayat.

The accused made fake documents for death, disability and of mass marriage ceremonies. The officials, who were part of the nexus, made the fake documents, verified them and then embezzled the government funds under the Karmkar scheme. When the accused realized that their fraud has come to light and they would be booked, they fled before the police could reach them. After the death of a labourer registered under the Karmkar scheme, the state government provides compensation of Rs 1 lakh to his family, said Berasia SHO Ajay Mishra. The scheme also offers Rs 1 lakh for disability while it provides Rs 50,000 for marriage in the family, the SHO added.

The village sarpanch and his secretary made fake death documents of 21 labourers, marriage documents of 10 labourers and fake document of one person under the differently abled in the scheme.

During investigation, all the labourers were found to be alive and no marriage ceremony had place taken at their home in the scheme, said the SHO. He added that the role of 32 others labourers is also under scanner in the fraud.

SHO Mishra said the fraud was started in 2018. Later, a verification officer was also included in the crime. The accused attached their different bank accounts to get compensation and transferred money after carrying out the formalities.

For the past few months, the authorities were getting information about labour fraud and a case was registered after corroborating the charges.

The accused were identified as sarpanch Balram Gurjar, panchayat secretary Om Prakash Sharma, panchayat verification and nodal officer Hukum Chand, panchayat coordinator of Berasia Uma Shankar and panchayat office-bearers Deep Singh, Bhagwan Singh, Mahesh Kumar and Pramod Vishwakarma.

SHO Mishra said cops have raided their homes, but the accused locked their houses and are on the run. They will be nabbed soon, Mishra added.

Title: IPS officer pitches himself for DGP post
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Bhopal: In an unprecedented act, Madhya Pradesh IPS officer Maithili Sharan Gupta on Saturday pitched himself publicly for the post of director general of police (DGP) amid speculation that incumbent DGP V K Singh may be shifted. Gupta is on the UPSC list for DGP that the state has rejected.

An officer of the 1984 batch, Gupta put up social media messages, declaring himself as an officer who has the capacity to ‘turn around policing in the state’. He also sought support from public and media.

“I feel others (esteemed journalists and good public personalities) should come forward to convey my point of view and potential to make a difference in delivery to public and transforming police as real saviour and helper. I would not like to project myself as victim or aggrieved. The state government should realise that I have the capacity to turn around policing in entire MP,” said his social media post. It went viral.

Special DG-police reforms, Gupta is one of the three IPS officers empaneled by Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) for the post of DGP, but the state government has rejected the list, saying one of the officers has not expressed his ‘willingness’ for the post.

The other two are incumbent DGP V K Singh and Vivek Kumar Johri, who is DG of Border Security Force. Johri, also of the 1984 batch, was special secretary in Research and Analysis Wing (RAW) before the appointments committee of cabinet, headed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and with home minister Amit Shah among its members, appointed him as head of BSF.

Controversy over DGP’s post erupted on February 8 after the Madhya Pradesh government rejected the UPSC panel.

MP home secretary Rajesh Kumar Jain wrote to the UPSC secretary that Johri has not given his ‘willingness’ for the post of DGP in writing, so naming him in the panel is against the mandate of UPSC guidelines for selection. He also wrote that state government would send a new proposal to the commission.

The next day, DGP V K Singh had a lengthy closed-door meeting with chief minister Kamal Nath. Singh passed it off as a routine meet, but the one-on-one with the CM took place after nearly a month, say sources.

Title: NMC starts issuing death certificates online
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Nashik: After birth certificates, the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) has now started providing online death certificates to citizens.

The facility has been running as a pilot project in the Panchavati division for the past fortnight. Officials said the service will soon start in other five divisions of the NMC — Nashik East, Nashik West, Nashik Road, Cidco and Satpur.

Municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game has directed the medical department of the municipal corporation to start providing death certificates online in five other divisions from the next week.

“We are making efforts to start the online distribution of death certificates to residents. The municipal commissioner has already directed us to start the online facility for six divisions of the NMC,” a civic body official said.

“The certificates are provided through WhatsApp and email. We have linked hospitals and crematoriums, which immediately inform the medical department of the NMC in case of a death. Once we receive this information, a death certificate is sent to citizens within 10 days,” the official added.

The NMC has also started the process of providing marriage certificates online. Currently, citizens have to visit divisional offices of NMC for physical submission of forms. They are also called for verification along with witnesses and relatives.

“But they will not need to come to the divisional offices to submit the form. They can do everything online and can also upload documents on the web. Citizens will have the option to select a time slot online, similar to the passport office,” said an official.

The NMC has been submitting online birth certificates since September 15. So far, over 11,000 birth certificates have been sent to parents via the web. The civic body has also connected with 400 hospitals in the city to secure details of newborns.

Title: Railways told to pay Rs 1.5 lakh to woman
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Ahmedabad: A consumer court has directed the Western Railway to pay Rs 1.5 lakh to a senior citizen who fell down and injured herself in 2011 while getting down from a coach on Surat platform, which was then under renovation.

According to case details, a resident of Gurukul, Ushaben Shukla, 79, had travelled from Ahmedabd to Surat in Shatabdi Express on April 4, 2011. The Surat railway station was under renovation and the height of the platform had been reduced. The elderly woman fell on the platform and suffered injuries while getting down from the coach.

Shukla was hospitalized and underwent a surgery before she was discharged a week later. She had to spend Rs 1.87 lakh for treatment and medicine. She approached the Surat district consumer dispute redressal forum seeking compensation from the railways authorities for the negligence by not keeping a standard distance between the steps of the coach and the platform so that the passengers do not face any difficulty. She also claimed that there were many instances of passengers falling on Surat platform due to the reduced height of the platform creating more space between the coach’s steps and the platform.

The consumer forum entertained Shukla’s petition. This brought the Western Railway to the Gujarat State Consumer Dispute Redressal Commission with an argument that the consumer forum does not have jurisdiction to entertain such a complaint. There is a specific provision of the Railway Claims Tribunal to redress such grievances.

The railway authorities also argued that the Surat railway station master office had not received a single complaint about passengers falling down while getting down from trains due to the faulty design of the station.

The consumer commission said that more care has to be taken at the time of getting down from railway coach at station. In this case, the complainant is a senior citizen and therefore more care was required to be taken by her. However, it would meet the ends of justice, if the railways paid Rs 1.5 lakh on lumpsum basis to the complainant.

Title: CBI probing role of MES officials in graft case
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Dehradun: After two employees of Military Engineering Services (MES) were caught accepting bribe in Dehradun , the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) is now probing other MES officials on suspicion that they deliberately red-flagged the progress report of contractors to receive bribes for different construction works in the hill state.

“The investigation has revealed that certain officials used to red-flag the progress report of contractors. Later, they would file a favourable report in return for financial gratification,” said a CBI official handling the case.

Last month, a CBI team had arrested an Assistant Garrison Engineer and a Junior Engineer from Dehradun Garrison Engineer office for accepting Rs 40,000 bribe from a Delhi-based contractor for clearing his payment of over Rs 20 lakh.

“In MES, senior officials have powers to give a slow progress report. We are probing roles of other MES officials in Dehradun too,” said the CBI official.

Title: China’s coronavirus outbreak has cotton industry feeling ill
Content: Nashik: The outbreak of coronavirus in China is taking a toll on cotton exports from India.China is a major market and India exports around 15 lakh cotton bales to it. However, since the coronavirus outbreak, exports from India have been temporarily stopped.“Last year, India had exported 15 lakh cotton bales (1.78 quintal in each bale) to China. So far this year, it could export only 4 lakh bales,” said Pradeep Jain, the president of the Khandesh Ginning and Pressing Factory Owners’ Association.This year, China was expected to import large volumes of cotton as its internal cotton reserves had reduced. It was to import more than 20 lakh bales of cotton from various countries — a bulk of which would have been from India,” said Jain. Such expectations had created a positive mood in the market and the prices of raw cotton had increased by Rs 200 per quintal to settle at Rs 5,300 per quintal in the first week of January.“But the outbreak of coronavirus has badly hit cotton exports from India. The export has stopped temporarily,” said Jain.The prices of cotton have now stabilised at around Rs 5,000 per quintal. The government is procuring cotton at the price of Rs 5,500 per quintal, but it is also expected to stop procurement of cotton from farmers soon.The market is so slow. The country has exported 28 lakh bales of cotton so far this year, against 50 lakh bales last year. The cotton export will get a boost if exports to China restarts in the next few days, added Jain.North Maharashtra includes four district — Nashik , Dhule, Jalgaon and Nandurbar. Of these, Jalgaon, Dhule and Nandurbar together are known as Khandesh. This belt is known to produce good quality cotton.The average area under cotton cultivation in North Maharashtra is 8.5 lakh hectare. Of which, cotton acreage in Nashik district is only 50,000 hectare, while it is over 8 lakh hectare in Khandesh. North Maharashtra contributes 10% of the country’s total export. While India exported around 50 lakh bales of cotton in 2018-19 (Oct-Sept), North Maharashtra along exported 5 lakh bales.This year, the incessant rains caused a loss to the cotton yield by almost 5% in North Maharashtra. But the production was the same as last year due to a rise in the acreage of cotton by 5%. The areas under cotton in North Maharashtra increased from 8.5 lakh hectares to 9 lakh hectares this year.

Title: Periyar followers hold rally, warn actor Rajini not to insult protestors
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Coimbatore: The Federation of Followers of Periyar on Sunday took out a ‘Blue Shirt’ rally from Anna Statue junction to Government Women Polytechnic College junction on Dr Balasundaram Road and passed a resolution against actor Rajinikanth, condemning him for his recent statement belittling people’s protest for various causes. It warned the actor to stop insulting the protestors. More than 2000 people participated in the rally. It has decided to conduct a state-wide protest and burn manu dharma books on May 21.

The federation also held a public meeting on abolition of caste. Addressing the gathering, Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi leader Thol Thirumavalavan said the people who were speaking about Tamil Desiyam were not ready to accept intercaste marriage. “Those involve in honour killing would have a Hindutva or Sangh Parivar background. So, we have to be careful of them. Ambedkarists, Periyarists and leftists should not allow Hindutva forces to set their foot in Tamil Nadu.”

Dravidar Kazhagam leader K Veeramani, meanwhile, presided over two intercaste marriages on the stage. He said it was the government’s duty to treat everyone equally and abolish the caste system. “The caste system should be eradicated from the country and the government should take initiative in this regard. In New Delhi, one person opened fire at anti-Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) protestors while police remained mute spectators. The country is ruled by the people who believe in Manusmṛiti and they are trying to divide the people. So, we are ready to sacrifice our lives to protest this,” he said.

On his part, May 17 Movement coordinator Thirumurugan Gandhi said the CAA was not only against Muslims. “If we are not standing with the Muslims, in future the act will affect us all. The Union government is working against the general public in matters related to education, employment and reservation. So, we have to unite and fight.”

Title: Livestock park to house vet college, modern dairy farm
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

The Advanced Institute for Integrated Research on Livestock and Animal Sciences to come up at Thalaivasal in Salem at a cost of Rs 1,024 crore is touted to be biggest in south Asia.

To be set up on 1,100 acres land, the institute will be of international standards and will have a veterinary college within, said chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami after laying the foundation stone for the project on Sunday.

Flanked by a battery of senior ministers from the state cabinet including his deputy O Panneerselvam, EPS said that the institute would revolutionize livestock and animal research in the country.

“The livestock park will have three components. The first will have a modern dairy farm and a state of the art veterinary hospital. In addition, there will be a facility for breeding of native cattle breeds like Umbalacheri, Alambadi and Bargur as well as one for native dogs like chippiparai and Kombai,’’ he said. Similar facility for protecting native goat breeds and pig rearing would also be a part.

The second component will be dedicated to production of value added products from fish, meat, egg and dairy. A 2000-sq. m. pisciculture farm would be set up to produce 20 lakh fishes every year which will be distributed to farmers for rearing.

The third component will be of academic nature where a complex for higher education, research centre for veterinary sciences and a training centre for farmers would be established. “A veterinary college at a cost of Rs 82.17 crore would be set up with a capacity of 80 seats,’’ EPS said.

In addition to the students of the proposed colleges, students from other veterinary institutes from across the globe, researchers and entreprenuers could visit and benefit from the facilities at the livestock park, EPS said.

Pointing out that research will be pursued to develop high yielding, disease resistant native as well as high bred cattle varieties, EPS said that the proposed modern dairy farm of international standards with a capacity of 500 heads of cattle will also feature a state of the art industrial unit which can make 12 types of value added dairy products. “An advanced fodder manufacturing unit of 50 tonne capacity will also be set up,’’ he said.

EPS said the ideas for the institute were picked up by him during his visit to livestock units in the US last year.

Title: ‘Farm schools to be started in all Krishi Bhavans’
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Thrissur: The state government will start farm schools’ in all Krishi Bhavans in the state next year, agriculture minister V S Sunilkumar said. “There are over 1,000 Krishi Bhavans in the state, and the target is that they together give informal lessons on farming to 10 lakh people in the next three years. This year itself such classes will be given to 2,000 people through farm schools ,” the minister said while inaugurating a workshop on ‘ Zero budget natural farming ’.

Apart from academically trained agricultural professionals, leading farmers in each area will also be giving lessons in farm schools on best agricultural practices suited to that area, the minister said. He said the farm schools will also give lessons on indigenous recipes. Orders have been issued to ensure only local food is served at the programmes organized by the agriculture department.

Sunilkumar also appealed to doctors to prescribe vegetables and fruits containing the vitamins, instead of tablets.

The agriculture and health departments launched a joint programme to provide nutritious food to the people. As part of the Jeevani programme, the health department will prepare recipes of healthy food based on indigenous grains, millets, vegetables (including leafy items), and fruits.

“They will also include many traditional items which were being consumed by the people here but are not included in the food items because of the changes in dietary patterns and life styles. The agriculture department will then try to promote the production of those food items. Students, teachers, social activists, mediapersons and all other sections in the society will be persuaded to join in the campaign Our Agriculture, Our Health,” the minister said.

Title: Mega flower show from Feb 20
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Nashik: The Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) is organising a three-day mega ‘Flower show 2020’ from February 20 at its headquarters in Rajiv Gandhi Bhavan .

The objective is to create awareness about flowers and various plants and encourage citizens towards sapling plantation in their houses and societies.

The municipal corporation has already made provision for the same in the budget for the current financial year. The civic body is expecting footfall of around 75,000 visitors for the flower show.

Around 60,000 people had visited the expo last year. This year, the municipal corporation is expecting 10% rise in visitor footfall.

“We are organising a flower expo this month in the Rajiv Gandhi Bhavan premises. The flower expo will begin from February 20 and will conclude on Feb 22. The objective is to create awareness about the utility to grow flowers and fruits among local residents,” said a senior NMC official.

Title: Govt seeks Rs 1,355 crore for new fishing harbours
Content: Gandhinagar: The Gujarat government has sought a sum of Rs 1,355 crore in grants or soft loan under the PM’s blue revolution scheme meant for enhancing fishing production. The state government expects a sizeable increase in fish production by investing in fishing infrastructure.In a proposal sent to the government of India (GOI), the state fisheries department, while demanding Rs 1,355 crore said, “Due to inadequate facilities, fishermen are experiencing difficulties in unloading their catch during fishing season. Moreover, lack of infrastructure facilities results into landing of fish catch in unhygienic conditions. This leads to deterioration of overall quality of fish products and increase of waste, affecting the price realisation and export, which ultimately leads to monetary loss to the fishermen.’’The state government has proposed to construct five new fishing harbours at Navabandar, Madhwad, Veraval, Porbandar and Sutrapada.The proposal states that the Gujarat fisheries department has established five fishing harbours and 18 fish landing centres (FLCs) for fisheries activities. There are about 24,720 mechanised fishing boats which operate in Gujarat. Present fishing harbours and fish landing centres are sufficient only to accommodate about 12% of these fishing boats.Sources in the government said, “Fishermen suffer monetary losses due to non-availability of berthing space in fishing harbours. One such experience was faced by the state during the cyclone in the year 2019. Therefore, it is necessary to develop additional fishing harbours and to strengthen the existing infrastructure facilities. For this purpose, the state government has submitted proposals for development of fishing harbours.’’Gujarat is the highest marine fish producing state in India, contributing about 20% of the country’s total marine fish production. Development of new fishing harbours will help in providing adequate landing, berthing and unloading facilities, officials said.

Title: Salem gets new cricket ground at a cost of Rs 3cr
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Salem: Chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami on Sunday inaugurated a new cricket ground in Kariveppilapatti near Thalaivasal here in the presence of former India captain Rahul Dravid. Former International Cricket Council (ICC) and Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) president N Srinivasan, Tamil Nadu Cricket Association (TNCA) president Rupa Gurunath and several state ministers were also present during the occasion.

Pleased with the infrastructure, Srinivasan said there might be a possibility that the ground, built by the Salem Cricket Foundation at a cost of Rs 3 crore, would be turned into a stadium in the near future and host Chennai Super Kings (CSK)’s Indian Premier League (IPL) matches. It was also learnt that TNCA will build temporary stands as it plans to host a few Tamil Nadu Premier League (TNPL) games in the forthcoming season. “If we build stands, the ground can seat around 15,000 spectators which is not bad for an IPL game. So, the TNPL matches will prove as a test event,” a TNCA source told TOI.

Palaniswami also assured that the state government would provide the required support to host the IPL matches. “As far as I know, IPL matches have not been conducted in any place other than Chennai in Tamil Nadu. So, Salem would turn out to be the first city to host the matches outside Chennai. The state government would extend all support for it,’’ he said.

The chief minister said the stadium would benefit the youth in the region and provide a fillip to the game of cricket.

Srinivasan said the stadium would initially host the Tamil Nadu Premier League T20 matches. With CSK set to start their IPL preparatory camp from the first week of March, the former BCCI chief said captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni might visit and inspect the ground along with coach Stephen Fleming. “Eventually, Dhoni would be playing matches in the stadium. So, he needs to take the call. I would like to request the chief minister to watch the match when Dhoni plays,’’ he said.

Lauding the state government and TNCA for developing the ground, Rahul Dravid, who is currently serving as the National Cricket Academy director, said the youth from smaller towns and cities would be playing a crucial role in the future of national cricket. “The next generation of heroes and talents in the country will come from smaller towns and cities and facilities like this would help them achieve their goal.”

The event was marked by a lighter moment when Dravid bowled a few balls to chief minister Edappadi K Palansiwami.

Title: Internship & Rs 2,500 stipend for students, says Yogi Adityanath
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

File photo

GORAKHPUR: In a key decision to tackle unemployment by equipping youths with skills and work experience, UP chief minister Yogi Adityanath on Sunday announced an internship programme under which students from Class 10 to graduation will get to work with technical institutes and industries for six months to one year and will be paid a stipend of Rs 2,500 per month during the period.

The Centre will contribute Rs 1,500 of the honorarium while the state will provide Rs 1,000, Yogi said after inaugurating the Rozgar Mela (employment fair) at Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Gorakhpur University.

“The internship scheme will be launched this year. Under this scheme, students from Class 10 to graduation will be linked to various technical institutes and industries. On completion of their internship, the government will assist them in placement through an HR cell, which will be set up soon,” he said.

The scheme is in sharp contrast to the unemployment allowance of the previous Samajwadi Party government, wherein jobless youths, aged between 25 and 40 years, having annual family income less than Rs 36,000, were given a monthly allowance of Rs 1,000.

Yogi said the government has also decided to ensure compulsory recruitment of at least 20% girls in state police. The CM claimed UP was the first state in the country which was successful in giving government jobs to more than 2.5 lakh youths within three years. The investment of more than Rs 2.5 lakh crore through Investors’ Summit also created employment opportunities for 35 lakh youths, he said.

“Through the department of labour and employment exchange, we have done three times more work in just three years than previous governments in five years,” he added.

The state government will be opening an ITI and a skill development centre in each tehsil to equip youths with skills to increase employability, the CM said.

“Our government has ended interviews for non-gazetted posts of class IV, III and II in the state to curb corruption and ensure transparency in recruitment,” Yogi added.

The CM said Defence Expo 2020 in Lucknow was a huge success and it will open the doors for creation of jobs in the state. “Defence chiefs and ambassadors of 70 countries attended the Expo. Many national and international companies signed MoUs for putting in money in the defence corridor, which will bring an investment of Rs 50,000 crore and employment for 5 lakh youths,” he said.

Title: Workhorse & guard dog: Ramnad Mandai a hit among city residents
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Madurai: Ever since the 2017 jallikattu movement, the push for promoting native breeds of animals has been significant and dog breeders see more people opting for native breeds such as the extremely rare ‘Mandai’ breed from rural Ramanathapuram.

"Mandai dogs are hound dogs that have been used mainly for hunting and herding sheep and goats in Ramanathapuram for generations. Local people are also possessive of them and do not even give away pups to others who are from a different place. Hardly around 10 people in a village here have these dogs," said P Venkatachalam, kennel owner from Ramanathapuram.

Venkatachalam, who is a breeder for almost 10 years now, recalled that Mandai dogs have a rich history in Ramanathapuram. "They are hard-working dogs mainly used to herd goats and sheep, particularly those species that are ferocious and fight. My father’s Mandai dog was almost the same height of a full-grown ram and it could herd cattle with ease," he said.

Now, Mandai dogs are being preferred as guard dogs in urban areas. "Their maintenance cost is low. We usually give kanji as food. They can guard really well and listen to only their owners with proper training. We got a good response for the breed from urban dog owners," said Venkatachalam. His kennel has sold many of their Mandai dog litter to owners from Bangalore, Chennai and Coimbatore for prices ranging between Rs 4,000 and Rs 6,000.

Madurai Canine Club president S Vinayaga Moorthy said that the club was trying its best to promote native breeds of dogs from villages. "Mandai dogs, which have a rich history of being used in temples, are only around 500 in population now. There are many breeds from villages that usually go unnoticed. Owners need to get certification and prove the purity of breed. This breed from Ramanathapuram has been certified only this year and we wanted to highlight it at our dog show to create awareness," he said.

Similarly, dog breeders and kennel owners said that the demand for native breeds, just like for Mandai dogs, has gradually been rising over the past few years. "The native breeds easily adapt and their maintenance cost is also low. They are also ferocious and are not intimidated by local stray dogs unlike some foreign breeds. Since most of them are hunting dogs, they are great guardians when trained," said Saran, owner of a two-month old Chippiparai pup. Kanni, Kombai, Chippiparai and Rajapalayam are some of the most sought-after native breeds of dogs from Tamil Nadu.

Title: 89 properties to go under the hammer in NMC auction
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Nashik: After receiving a poor response to the amnesty scheme, the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) has decided to auction properties of 89 taxpayers for defaulting tax payment amounting to Rs 23 lakhs.

This is for the second time that NMC is auctioning such defaulters properties. Last time such action was taken last month. The auction of the properties is set to be held on February 26 at Dadasaheb Gaikwad auditorium in the city.

Out of the 89 properties going under the hammer, 67 are from the Nashik Road division which has total dues of Rs 13.5 lakhs. Ten properties are from the Cidco division, which has pending dues amounting to Rs 6.5 lakhs while the remaining seven properties are from Satpur division with total dues of around Rs 3 lakhs.

“If we do not get a response from the bidders during the auction of the properties, we will take a call on changing the ownership of the properties in the name of NMC,” said an NMC official.

Last month, the NMC had put on an auction of 44 properties, which had defaulted property tax dues amounting to Rs 50 lakhs. Eight defaulters paid their dues totally worth Rs 3.68 lakh. Hence, an auction for only 36 properties was held in the first week of January with not a single bidder turning up for the bidding process.

In July last year, the NMC had put on an auction of 172 properties with total defaulting taxes amounting to Rs 2.84 crores but even at that time, it received a cold response from the bidders.

“It is difficult to inform about the reasons why people do not participate in auctioning of properties. But sometimes, the titles of the properties are not clear or there have been some loan burdens on the properties,” said an NMC official.

To counter this issue, the NMC will now convert the properties to their names. “If we do not receive a response to the auction of properties for the second time, NMC may take over these properties following approval of the standing committee,” said an official.

NMC has set a property tax collection target of Rs 218 crores for the current financial year 2019-20. So far, they have collected taxes amounting to Rs 118 crores, which is still short by Rs 100 crores.

Title: Illegal phone exchange: More likely to be arrested
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Malappuram: More arrests are likely in connection with the illegal telephone exchanges busted in Noida and Malappuram , in which a man from Palakkad was arrested , defence sources said.

The exchanges were busted in a joint operation by the CID wing of the Mumbai police and military intelligence officers. Thacharayil Hillar, 34, of Chalissery in Palakkad, was arrested on Thursday from Malappuram.

Inspector Basheer Chirakkal of Changaramkulam police said the case was registered by Mumbai police, and Hillar was taken into custody from a rented room at Changaramkulam town.

Several electronic devices were also seized from his room, the inspector said. The Mumbai police team had approached Malappuram district police chief U Abdul Kareem, seeking support for the raid. Changaramkulam police was ordered to assist the Mumbai police personnel.

“We have learnt that the person was a part of an international criminal gang, which operated the parallel telephone exchanges with the support of Chinese technology. The gang managed to divert internet calls from Gulf countries through a parallel channel for monetary benefits,” inspector Chirakkal said.

“We have no further details,” he added.

Quoting defence sources, news agencies reported that the illegal voice over internet protocol (VoIP) exchanges were used by callers suspected to be linked to Pakistani spy agency ISI to gather information about important defence installations.

Two Sim boxes with 100 slots each, nearly 200 Sim cards, routers, modems and other communication devices procured from China were seized in the raids in Noida, Uttar Pradesh and Changaramkulam.

It has been suspected that the entire operation could be an attempt to compromise internal security, defence sources said.

A probe was launched after defence personnel in September 2019 received calls from suspicious numbers, seeking information on important defence installations. The callers had fictitious identities and the involvement of ISI was suspected, defence sources said, adding investigations revealed illegal VoIP exchanges in Noida and in Kerala which routed incoming calls from Pakistan to local numbers.

Hillar had gone to the UAE after completing his graduation eight years ago. In Dubai, he met the members of a similar racket. On returning to India, he replicated the illegal exchange.

Inspector Chirakkal said the cyber wing of Kerala police was checking the possible existence of similar exchanges in the state.

Title: 300 dogs dazzle crowd at Madurai dog show
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Madurai: As many as 300 dogs of around 35 different breeds from across the country took part in the 33rd and 34th All Breeds Championship Dog show held at the Gandhi Museum Ground in Madurai on Sunday.

The event, organised by the Madurai Canine Club, saw dogs star in the ring with their owners, showcasing their beauty and talent. The audience was enthralled by the display from Indian breeds such as Rajapalayam, Chippiparai, Kanni, Kombai, and Caravan Hound and foreign breeds such as Afghan Hound, Fox Terrier, German Shepherd, Dobermann, St Bernard, Rottweiler, Pug, Golden Retriever, Beagle, Min Pin, Bull Dog, French Bull Dog, and Bull Mastiff.

The shows were adjudged by international judges Robert LT Dawson and Jonathan Messach authorised by FCI, the world’s largest canine organisation. "This year, as an initiative, we also held demonstrations and created awareness among school students about having dogs as pets. In the era of technology, we wanted to highlight the importance of connecting with nature and animals," said S Vinayaga Moorthy, president, Madurai Canine Club.

A special parade of ‘Mandai’ dogs from Ramanathapuram was also held to create awareness about the rare native breed. Around 10,000 dog owners, kennel owners, students and public took part in the show.

Title: Ahmedabad Temperature: Mercury set to rise in next three days
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Ahmedabad on Sunday recorded 26.8°C as maximum and 12.4°C as minimum temperature

AHMEDABAD: With change in wind direction, the minimum temperature in Ahmedabad and major cities of Gujarat have recorded a rise. India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted 3-4C rise in minimum temperature in next three days with easterly to southeasterly winds over the region.

Ahmedabad on Sunday recorded 26.8C as maximum and 12.4C as minimum temperature, 3.1 degrees and 0.8 degrees lower than the average. Several areas of the city recorded windy weather in morning hours.

Naliya was the coldest in the state with 6.2 degrees of minimum temperature, followed by Keshod (10.6 degrees), Kandla (10.9 degrees), Deesa (11.8 degrees) and Gandhinagar (12 degrees).

Met department officials said that it’s unlikely that the minimum temperature would go much lower than the current conditions in next few days. “This winter, the change in wind directions have resulted in see-saw behaviour of the minimum temperature,” said an official.

Title: NMC paid 366 surplus teachers Rs22 crore per year for last 6 years
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Nagpur: Despite facing a cash crunch and high administrative expenses, Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) has been employing 366 surplus teachers in its schools for last over six years. When this came to the notice of municipal commissioner Tukaram Mundhe, he directed NMC education department to send a proposal to the state education department to transfer the surplus teachers.

In the wake of chief secretary Ajoy Mehta’s review meeting on NMC’s working on Monday, Mundhe held review meetings with head of all departments on Thursday. Mundhe learnt about the 366 surplus teachers with NMC-run schools and directed education officer Priti Mishrikotkar to submit a proposal to the state education department to absorb them as soon as possible.

As per NMC data, there are 3,000 sanctioned posts of teachers in NMC. The civic body has 1,121 teachers currently. However, the state government rules require NMC to employ two teachers for the first 60 students, and one more teacher for every 30 extra students for primary schools. The students-teacher ratio for higher primary and secondary schools is different.

NMC is operating 131 primary and higher primary schools, and 29 secondary schools. The student strength in NMC schools is around 18,000. As per the government student-teacher ratio, NMC requires 755 teachers, but is maintaining 1,121 teachers, making for a surplus of 366.

The government norms also make mandatory for NMC to transfer surplus teachers to the state’s education department for employment at zilla parishad or government-aided schools of any district in the state. Accordingly, NMC sent a proposal to the state’s education department in 2014-15, but did not pursue it. No reminder letter too has been sent by NMC to the department in last six years.

Each teacher gets over Rs50,000 per month salary. Calculated at an average Rs50,000 per month, salaries of 366 surplus teachers come to over Rs22 crore per annum. For primary and higher primary teachers, NMC bears 50% salary while remaining is given by the government. For secondary teachers, government pays the entire salary. Most of the 366 surplus teachers are from primary and higher primary schools.

Thus, NMC and government have been facing a loss for over six years.

A NMC official told TOI teachers were not sent to state education department as the general body had in 2009 passed a resolution not to send teachers of NMC schools to state. “Now, NMC education department has submitted a proposal to the civic chief and appropriate decision will be taken in next couple of days,” the official said.

It is likely to become a hot topic in NMC as teachers unions are said to be very strong. Consequently, teachers have protection of NMC office bearers and corporators.

Title: District admins perform last rites of 2 who died in Japan
Content: Bhubaneswar: Family members of two youths, who died in Japan, were denied permission to perform their last rites by the district administrations of Balasore and Jajpur due to coronavirus fear. Instead, the funerals were performed on Sunday by two teams of medical staff from the district headquarters hospitals.Sources said Sheikh Mantaz, a resident of Bhograi block in Balasore, and Sheikh Baruddin, from Jajpur’s Barchana block, who were working in a restaurant in Tokyo, Japan, died due to asphyxiation on January 29. Their bodies were brought in a special box from Tokyo to Kolkata and from there to Bhubaneswar airport.“Since the body was brought from another country, we convinced the family not to touch the body and they agreed. We provided all protection like masks, gloves and dress to four persons from the village who helped in the burial,” said Dr Banarjee Prasad Chhotray, CDMO, Balasore.“The burial was done in the presence of police and health officials,” said Barchana BDO, Ajit Narayan Prasad Giri.

Title: Burglars flee with cash, vehicle keys
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Ahmedbad: A resident of Navrangpura, Nandan Shah, 37, lodged a complaint at Navrangpura police station on Sunday alleging that during the early hours of the day, at about 4am, two unidentified persons had entered his house through the kitchen door and fled with two costly watches, Rs 1,000 in cash and the keys of a scooter and a car.

According to the FIR lodged by Shah, who works as a finance executive in a private hospital, he came home on Saturday night and went to sleep after dinner. “At about 4am he was woken by some noise in the house. He peeped through the bedroom door and saw two persons, one wearing a brown jacket and another a white sweater searching for something in the kitchen,” said a police officer.

The FIR mentions that both burglars then jumped through the gallery of the kitchen Shah began shouting and other family members of Shah also woke up.

Meanhwile, Shah’s sister called up the police control room and lodged a complaint under sections 457, 380 and 114 of IPC. “We are hunting for the accused and checking CCTV footage,” said a police official.

Title: Banks to complete Aadhaar verification in a week
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

SLUG: CROP LOAN WAIVER SCHEME

Nashik: With the state government drawing a deadline of April 15 for implementing the loan waiver scheme, the banks have now been asked to clear the process of merging the Aadhaar-linked accounts of the farmers to get the exact number and amount owed by the beneficiaries in the district.

The accounts of more than 92% of farmers — beneficiary of Mahatma Jyotirao Phule Farmers loan waiver scheme — have been uploaded on the portal and the remaining would be completed in the span of eight days and the scrutiny will also be carried out alongside.

Suraj Mandhare, collector of Nashik , said, “Around 92% of the accounts have been uploaded on the portal for crop loan waiver scheme announced by the state government. We have asked the banks to conduct the scrutiny of the Aadhaar-linked accounts to figure out if the particular beneficiary has more than Rs 2 lakh loan — the limit set by the state government.”

The collector pointed out that 99% of all the accounts were already Adhaar-linked after which the process of uploading the data was being carried out.

After having run through various checks, by the district administration, the numbers of farmers that fall in the category of outstanding loan below Rs 2 lakh is 1.46 lakh of which 1.08 lakh are with the Nashik District Central Cooperative (NDCC) Bank.

According to the collector, the data of 1.07 lakh farmers having accounts with the NDCC has been uploaded on the portal. The process of uploading the remaining data will be completed in couple of days.

Similarly, in case of the private and nationalised banks, the number of beneficiaries is 37,674 and data of 26,313 farmers is yet to be uploaded.

“The government agencies in the state have performed well given the high number of farmers, the beneficiaries, the loan accounts,” the collector said.

Title: New colour code to be in force from March 1
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: The new colour code scheme for contract carriages will be in force from March 1 . The colour code was approved in a state transport authority (STA) meeting.

The contract carriage vehicles shall be painted in white with a violet ribbon of 10cm width with a metallic gold ribbon of 3cm width above the violet ribbon at the centre of the exterior of the side body.

The directive of the transport authority mentions about the specific size and colour to display the name of vehicle, if any. The name of the vehicle can be painted in white at the top of the front side of the vehicle in a normal font with a size not more than 12inch. Name of the operator or any other details can be painted in a column not more than 40cm height at rear portion of the vehicle and at full width of the vehicle.

The STA directive follows the high court order which declared that exhibition of gigantic figures of film stars or writings on the bus body and safety glass shall not be allowed. Also, the recent incidents of rash driving by tourist buses brought for tour programmes for school students led the authority to expedite the measures for road safety.

“Now, there is no uniform colour for the contract carriages plying in the state. It can be seen that most of the contract carriages are painted with figures of film stars, international players, pictures of wild animals, birds and with peculiar type of colour combinations... These paintings often attract the attention of other road users causing accidents. Therefore uniform colour code is to be enforced taking into consideration of all these factors and road safety concerns,” states the directive of STA.

While the new vehicles will have to follow the colour code for vehicle registration from March 1, the existing contract carriages will have to change the colour before they are brought for next fitness test.

“Only the new vehicles brought for registration from March will have to comply with the order. As only basic colours are fixed for the vehicle, the expenditure related to painting the vehicle will be 60% less. The similar colour code introduced for private bus operators was not a financial burden,” said transport minister A K Saseendran.

Title: Godman elopes with married woman after ‘satsang’
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Nagpur: A godman in his late 30s left a scandalous trail at a village in Bhandara district when he eloped with a married woman after a weeklong ‘Bhagwat katha satsang’. Now on way to Uttar Pradesh, the godman also told the woman’s husband that he was heading to Vrindavan with his ‘Radha’.

On Saturday, Bhandara police managed to zero down upon the godman and the woman, mother of a five-year-old daughter, in Vrindavan and were bringing both of them back to Nagpur.

It’s learnt the godman, known to have had several such flings with women in the past, had conducted a ‘satsang’ at the village between January 27 and February 3. He had also been invited for ‘satsang’ in the same village last year. Sources said the godman, who is a native of Nagpur district, also frequented the village on various pretexts over the last one year.

During his latest ‘satsang’, sources in the village said the godman stayed at the residence of the married woman. During his stay the family of the married woman had noticed some unusual closeness between the two, and their frequent talks too had been noticed.

The woman and the godman were also active on social media. The family of the woman told the police that the illicit relationship may have grown deeper due to their frequent communication on social media.

Suspicious of her behaviour, the woman’s family had started keeping a watch on her after the satsang. On February 4, the woman was slapped by her husband after he caught her speaking to the godman on phone. Later the same evening, the woman is learnt to have jumped from the first floor of her residence to flee the place. The family tried to trace her but she could not be found.

On February 5, the family landed up at Bhandara police station to lodge a missing complaint. The police had called up the godman on phone. He confessed having eloped with the woman, and also revealed their plan to visit Vrindavan, when her husband spoke on the phone.

Senior PI Sudhakar Chavan of Bhandara police station said the phone location showed the godman was at the same village when the woman fled her home.

SP Arvind Salve of Bhandara said the woman would be handed over to the family, but it would be up to her if she wanted stay at her in-laws place or go somewhere else. “Police will not force the woman to go anywhere against her wish. She is an adult and is free to do what she wants,” he said.

Title: Liquor in Bihar: Liquor flows from water tanker in Bihar
Content:
Officials inspect the tanker used for ferrying liquor

PATNA: A tanker (container) meant for supply of drinking water is being used for transporting smuggled liquor in ‘dry’ Bihar .Interestingly, the tanker having slogans of the government’s populist schemes such as ‘Swachh Bharat Abhiyan’ and ‘Beti Padhao, Beti Bachao’ written on it, was seized from Chakia village under Majhi police station limit in Saran district on Saturday. Altogether 330 cartons of India made foreign liquor (IMFL) manufactured in Haryana besides 400 pouches of country liquor were seized from the tanker.Majhi police station SHO Neeraj Kumar Mishra said on Sunday that a specially designed crater was made inside the tanker to store the liquor bottles. To make the transportation of alcohol foolproof, a car was moving ahead of the tanker to escort it. The car was also seized. Kunal Kumar Singh (liner) and tanker driver Sonu Kumar were arrested. During interrogation, the driver revealed that the consignment was to be delivered to bootleggers operating in Saran and Siwan districts.SHO Mishra said, “Initially driver Sonu, a resident of Indra Colony in Aligarh, tried to mislead the police by disclosing that he was carrying drinking water in the container. But, water didn’t flow from the tap even after being pressed repeatedly by the cops. The search of the tanker led to recovery of liquor.”Saran SP Har Kishore Rai said the seized consignment was to be supplied during Holi when the demand of liquor will be high. “All the police stations across the district, especially those located along the Bihar-UP border, have been put on alert and the SHOs concerned have been asked to check all the vehicles entering the district,” he said.The SP said the water tanker bearing the registration number of UP was seized following a tip-off. To a question, the SP said it was being ascertained whether the tanker was earlier used for the purpose.Senior police officers are baffled over the novel modus operandi adopted by the liquor smugglers in Bihar where use of alcohol is prohibited. Bootleggers have also used coffin boxes, cycle tubes and vegetables to hide liquor bottles and bring them in from Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan. “There have been instances when liquor bottles were smuggled inside fruits like watermelon,” a senior police officer said.The officer further said, “The smugglers keep on changing their modus operandi to avoid detection. Sometimes they move in afternoon as most checks happen at night.”Manufacture, sale and consumption of liquor is banned in the state under Bihar Excise and Prohibition Act 2016.In Video: Watch: Water tanker stuffed with smuggled liquor seized in ‘dry’ Bihar

Title: Authorities want Airport Road users to obey wardens
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Pune: The airport authorities have requested flyers to follow the traffic wardens’ instructions to ease the traffic jams along the new airport road.

“We have taken up several infrastructural projects. There are traffic congestions during rush hours. We request passengers to cooperate with the traffic wardens,” the authorities said.

Early on Sunday, a flyer posted a photograph of the new airport road that was jammed with traffic. It is the same situation in the late evening, sources said.

An airport official tweeted, “This pertains to the alighting point at the departure entry gates, exit at the arrival area and the public roads in front of the terminal building.”

In a conversation last week with TOI, Pune airport director Kuldeep Singh had said the airport will have better access once the major projects are completed. The airport authorities are looking at the handing over of around 34 acres of land.

The new airport road is also used by people going towards Symbiosis College via the VIP Road. Right from 509 Chowk, the road is crammed and the traffic leaving the airport worsens it. Passengers alight from the autorickshaws or cabs at this chowk and walk towards the airport so as to not miss flights, a frequent flyer added.

Wadgaon Sheri MLA Sunil Tingre, who is also vice president of the Pune Airport Advisory Committee, told TOI that there were plans for more alternative roads to the airport.
