Title: ‘Budget will help in development of the 3rd and 4th line to decongest the Bhusawal section’
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

One of the busiest and important railway stations in the Bhusawal division , the Nashik Road railway station has decided to uplift the passenger amenities and help in the overall development of the station. In a freewheeling interview with TOI’s Abhilash Botekar, the divisional railway manager, Vivek Kumar Gupta shares his thoughts on the future plans.

What are the immediate development plans for the Nashik Road station?

The Nashik Road station is one of the most important stations for the division – considering the footfall and the revenue earnings from it. Hence, we at Bhusawal division have decided to extend the foot-over bridge (FOB) to platform number 4 at Bhusawal-end and provide two more elevators at the station. One elevator will be attached to the new extension of FOB on PF 4 and another elevator has been sanctioned at the current booking office. This has been sanctioned to help the passengers access the FOB on PF 1, who otherwise have to go round about the booking office to get to the escalator.

How has the Union Budget helped Nashik and Bhusawal division on an overall basis?

The budget sanctioned 400 crores for the construction of road over bridges and 500 crores for improvement of signals in the division. Not only that, the budget has sanctioned good funds for the development of the 3rd and 4th line which is required to decongest the Manmad, Jalgaon, Bhusawal sections. They often witness huge train traffic coming from Northern, Western, Eastern, South Central, and Mumbai (Central) sides.

Will train connectivity to South India and Konkan improve?

As mentioned Bhusawal – Jalgaon – Manmad is the busiest sections on the Central Railway route. Upgradation of the system is being undertaken on war-footing in the region and the budget has made several provisions towards the same. This will take at least a couple of years to realise that the infrastructure is ready and hence starting a new train before that looks to be a difficult task. The private train operators running high-speed trains may have some other ideas and could introduce few on the routes.

How many high-speed trains will originate from the Bhusawal division?

At this point in time there are no private trains being planned from the Bhusawal division. But the division will have six high-speed trains passing through – as they will originate from Mumbai, Pune and Surat. Two trains from Mumbai will benefit Nashik, three from Pune will pass through Manmad and Bhusawal, while one train is expected from Surat passing through Bhusawal.

What are railways’ plans for harvesting solar energy?

The railways have decided to build roof-top solar power facilities at all the new railway station buildings. So the three stations of Dhule, Jamda and Shirud being constructed on Chalisgaon – Dhule link will have solar roof-top fittings as standard equipment. On the old buildings, we are taking it on case to case basis. Meanwhile, we have also decided to construct a solar power farm at the Traction Sub-Stations of Chalisgaon, Akola and Murtizapur as we have ample space along the tracks.

Title: 19 Gadchiroli teachers booked for missing electoral duties
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Nagpur: The Gadchiroli district administration has initiated action against 19 teachers of zilla parishad (ZP) schools and anganwadis in Aheri taluka under Representation of Peoples Act, 1950. Similar action for dereliction of electoral duties has also been initiated against some teachers of Buldhana district.

The offence, though a non-cognizable one, can lead to imprisonment of the teachers for not less than three months but which can extend to two years and also a fine. Aheri police, who registered the offence on February 6, would now seek permission of the court to investigate the case. The complaint was lodged by the naib tehsildar.

It’s learnt the teachers were part of 93 government employees assigned duties as Booth Level Officers (BLO). After a notification by the Election Commissioner of India, the work of Electoral Verification Programme (EVP) was initiated around a month-and-a-half ago. There was a meeting of the 93 BLOs at the office of the Sub-Divisional Police Officer (SDPO). An ‘absolute list’ is prepared after the EVP is completed, with deletion of names, like those who died or left the place, or inclusion of new voters.

Sources said the teachers of Aheri taluka had together decided to protest the election duty, following which three meetings were held with them. A show cause notice was also served to the teachers for not joining the programme.

A source said the teachers tried to plead that ZP authorities were pressuring them to raise the level of education, with added workload. During the meetings, probationary IAS officer Rahul Gupta, Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) and tehsildar Omkar Otari tried to explain to the teachers that the duties under Election Commission of India cannot be ignored.

Collector Deepak Singla said the BLOs were still reluctant, and did not turn up for the assigned electoral duties.

Otari said no exemption was possible for these 19, and they are also given special annual remuneration for the work. “Apart from education department, other government employees are also involved, and compelled to work with additional responsibilities. Most of our work of electoral verification is over except that assigned to the teachers,” he said. “The teachers from other adjoining talukas too have attended duties,” he said.

Gadchiroli ZP CEO Vijay Rathod also said that departmental action may be initiated against the teachers after receiving a report from the SDM and tehsildar.

SDM (in-charge) Gupta said there is a Supreme Court guideline making electoral duties mandatory for government employees. “We had taken a liberal stand, and then also warned them, but finally had to take punitive action,” he said.

SP Shailesh Balkawade said, “We will seek guidance from the court to go ahead with the probe.”

Title: Seven Pune police constables dismissed from service
Content:
Representative image

PUNE: The Pune city police has dismissed as many as seven police constables in the first week of February for various reasons ranging from absenteeism, disrespect towards seniors and towards duty, among others.Additional commissioner of police (administration) Sanjay Shinde told TOI, “We have taken stern action against the policemen for violating several service codes and they have been dismissed from their services.”“We will not tolerate any indiscipline by the policemen. They will have to follow the rule books properly,” Shinde added.The senior officer said that one of the dismissed constables last reported to work three years ago. “We requested him to resume his job and sent a policeman to his house to inquire about his health. However, he did not report to work. We gave him sufficient time to resume duties but he failed to do so and then we decided to dismiss him from the service,” Shinde said.Similarly, a woman constable was in charge of the work of passport verification at a police station. While executing her duties, she demanded Rs 1,000 from an applicant to clear the passport verification process. “The passport applicant contacted senior police officers and it was decided to dismiss her,” Shinde said. According to the police, the woman constable had joined the city unit only about two years ago.A police naik has been dismissed from service for remaining absent for over two years. “When we called him to inquire about his absenteeism, he started abusing senior police officers. When police officers decided to call an inquiry against him, he issued threats to them. This behavior is not at all accepted,” Shinde said.A senior police officer said that police officer may remain absent, in some cases even for a long time, but they must provide a valid reason for their absenteeism. “If the reason is justifiable, he or she can resume their duties. The valid reasons include serious health issues, serious family issues, and others. However, the constable or police officers must follow some rules while on proceeding on leave. For instance, they are required to submit their health certificates duly signed by the appropriate medical officers,” the officer explained.Shinde said, “In many cases, it has been found that the police constables and officers do not follow proper ethics and decorum. They are also disrespectful towards their seniors by passing comments and abusing them.”The dismissed police constables can approach the Maharashtra Administrative Tribunal against the orders issued by the city police seeking remedy against their dismissal.

Title: 5 criminals externed from city
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Nashik: The Nashik city police have externed five criminals from the city for a period of two years. They were externed on the backdrop of their criminal activities in the past.

Those externed have been identified as Ganesh Jadhav (24) of Satpur, Kalpesh Gunjal (23) of Gangapur, Sagar Kumavat (25) of Bhadrakali, Vishal Koli (38) of Adgaon and Wasim Abdul Rehman Shaikh (27) of Wadala Road.

With the exception of Shaikh who has been externed for a period of one year, the remaining four criminals have been externed for a period of two years from the city and the district.

A senior officer of the Zone 1 police station said that the externed criminals had serious body and property offences registered against them. The externment procedure was undertaken to curb their criminal attitude.

The officer said that under the instructions of commissioner of police Vishwas Nangare-Patil, they were taking strict action against those who had two or more cases registered against them.

Last year, city police took strict preventive action against 148 seasoned criminals.

Police officers said that the action against habitual criminals has helped in maintaining law and order in the city, especially during the state assembly elections last year.

Title: Pune Death Case: Pune techie jumps to death, case against hubby and in-laws
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: The harassment from her medical practitioner husband and her in-laws led a 34-year-old software engineer to jump to her death from the balcony of her fifth floor flat in Manikbaug in Chinchwad on Saturday.

The Chinchwad police on Sunday registered an offence against the husband and the in-laws after her father lodged an FIR against them.

Abhijit Jadhav, assistant inspector of the Chinchwad police, said the woman died around 4.30pm. Her husband, in-laws and her three-year-old son were at home. “The couple quarrelled over some issue, following which the woman went to the balcony and jumped,” Jadhav said.

She was taken to a nearby hospital where the doctors pronounced her dead, he added.

“Her father stated in the complaint that since his daughter’s marriage in 2015, her husband and in-laws were physically and mentally harassing her. They wanted Rs 25 lakh from her parents to buy a new flat. We have registered the offence and our probe is on,” Jadhav said.

Title: Cong: Shivraj shielding lynching mastermind
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Bhopal: State Congress media coordinator, Narendra Saluja, on Sunday accused former chief minister Shivraj Singh Chauhan of defending the alleged mastermind of Manawar lynching incident, Ramesh Junapani and said that a former chief minister defending a person, who led the lynching mob which killed a farmer and seriously injured five more, just because he happens to be his supporter is below his dignity.

He further said that Chauhan had tried to “shield” BJP leader, Devendra Tamrakar, also after he was accused of rape by a woman. Chouhan had gone to the extent of holding a public meeting at Ashok Nagar in his favour.

The two incidents in question clearly show that the BJP in MP stands with the criminals and not with the common people, which is “shameful”, he added.

Saluja further said Chauhan’s statement that Congress government in the state was “implicating” BJP leaders in all the major incidents of crimes to escape responsibility for deteriorating law & order situation was “childish and ridiculous” and the truth was quite the contrary.

He said whether it be incident of municipal council chairman Prahlad Badhwar’s murder or killing of VHP leader Yuvraj Singh in Mandsaur, local BJP leader Manish Bairagi and Bajrang Dal district convener Vikky Kausar were found involved in the two incidents respectively.

Similarly, Tarachand Rathore, who has links with the BJP, was found involved in the murder of BJP leader Manoj Thakre in Badwani.

Chauhan was very articulate in criticizing law & order situation in the state when BJP leader Himmat Patidar was apparently killed but it later turned out that Patidar had himself killed his servant to get the amount of insurance by fraud. BJP leaders were also found involved in the abduction ad killing of two siblings from Chitrakot town, he said.

He exhorted Chauhan to ascertain the facts about cases of major crimes before hurling charges on the Congress government in MP.

Former minister and BJP leader Vishwas Sarang while defending Chauhan said that video of the incident clearly shows that Junapani was trying to save the farmers after mob attacked them, he was not inciting them and he has only been implicated in the case because he is a BJP worker. What Chauhan has said is not wrong at all. The Congress government in the state has not been able to handle law & order situation in the state ad for “face saving”, it is framing BJP leaders in one case after another, which is highly objectionable and will be resisted not only by Chauhan but the BJP party as a whole.

Shivraj Singh Chauhan could not be contacted for comments.

Title: RTO registers a slump in orders for fancy numbers
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Pune: The special or choice registration numbers issued by the Pune regional transport office (RTO) has registered a drop between April and November 2019-20 as compared to the same period in the last two financial years.

Altogether 15,855 special choice numbers were issued between April and November in the current financial year, while 19,540 were issued in 2018-19, and 21,307 in 2017-18.

“It is difficult to pinpoint the reason for the drop in special/choice registration numbers issued between April and November. One reason could be that lesser number of vehicles was registered in the current fiscal. There is still two more months to go before the financial year ends and we are hopeful that the figures will rise,” deputy regional transport officer (RTO) Vinod Sagare told TOI.

The officials said that the vehicle registration figures from April to December were currently being compiled.

If one compares the month-to-month revenue earned by the RTO, the figures earned from the sale of special registration numbers in 2019-20 (barring May and November) have been less when compared to the last two fiscals. For example, the RTO earned a revenue of around Rs2 crore from the sale of these special registration numbers in May 2019-20.

During the same month in 2018-19 and 2017-18, the RTO earned Rs1.7 crore and Rs1.3 crore respectively. However, it garnered a revenue of Rs1.3 crore in June 2019-20. The RTO earned around Rs1.9 crore in 2018-19 and Rs1.9 crore in 2017-18.

“I wanted to get a number which reflected my date of birth. The RTO comes out with a series of special numbers almost every fortnight which are auctioned. However, the number which I wanted was not in the series. So, I approached the RTO to consider my case. I was told that there were four more people who wanted the same number and realised that the cost will be huge. So, I dropped the idea,” Ganesh Tambe, a resident of Kothrud told TOI.

Another buyer, who got a two-digit special registration number for his newly-bought SUV, said, “The number was in the series but there were many takers. I paid a big amount but made sure I got the number.”

An RTO official said people opt for special numbers due to various reasons. “For some, it is their guru, who has advised them to go for a certain number. Then, there are some who ha0ve dreamt about a number and hence they want it. There are those who choose numbers according to the birthdates of their children or wives,” he said.

Title: Coronavirus in Pune: 26-year-old from Pune quarantined to rule out coronavirus infection
Content:
Representative image

PUNE: A traveller who recently returned from China was isolated at the civic-run Naidu hospital on Sunday after he complained of minor illness, to rule out the novel coronavirus infection “The newly-quarantined traveller is 26-years-old. He is a local resident and retunred from Hong Kong in China on February 2. He had been under our surveillance every since he came back. We quarantined him on Sunday when he developed cough and fever,” Ramchandra Hankare, the chief of the Pune Municipal Corporation’s health department, said.The man’s throat swab sample will be tested at the National Institute of Virology (NIV) for the novel coronavirus infection, he added.A total of 21,203 passengers returning from China and other affected countries have so far been screened at Mumbai’s Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) since January 18. Of them, 151 travellers, who are residents of Maharashtra, were put under 14-day surveillance.Of the 151 travellers, 36 were quarantined in Mumbai, Pune, Nagpur and other parts of the state only after they developed minor illness in the form of cold, cough, fever, weakness and body ache.“Of the 36 travellers who developed minor illnesses, 31 have tested negative for the coronavirus infection in the state so far, following which they were discharged. The remaining five travellers are still under isolation as their reports are awaited,” a state health official said.Pune was reeling under acute shortage of N95 masks because of the significant rise in their export to novel coronavirus-affected countries. The city got some relief after the Union government banned its export on January 31.N95 masks are considered effective in preventing the airborne virus from entering the human body.However, experts said that only those working in close proximity with isolated travellers and in their close contact need the N95 masks.“As per the WHO guidelines, only medical staff involved in the care of isolated travellerers and their immediate contacts should use these masks. Other people should not panic and rush to buy masks,” Sanjay Patil, an eye surgeon and the president of the city chapter of Indian Medical Association (IMA), said.

Title: Congress targets govt over SC ruling on reservation in jobs
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

NEW DELHI: Protesting against the Supreme Court order that reservation in jobs and promotions for SCs/STs were not a fundamental right, Congress accused the Modi government of inflicting a "big damage" to the key empowerment tool available to Dalits and asked BJP to clarify its stand on the verdict. BJP ally Lok Janshakti Party too said it did not agree with the Supreme Court ruling.

The opposition plans to take up the issue in Parliament on Monday, in what could turn proceedings stormy in the two Houses.

Disagreeing with the verdict, Congress member Mukul Wasnik said the Uttarakhand government told the court during the hearing that quotas were not a fundamental right and their implementation rested on the discretion of the state government. He added that counsels representing the state had occupied senior positions (in the Centre) while Uttarakhand was also ruled by BJP.

"Modi government should clarify if it believes that reservation for SCs/STs is a fundamental right or not, whether or not it is the constitutional duty of the government to provide quotas," he said at a press conference with Dalit functionary and former MP Udit Raj. "What has happened is contradictory to the position BJP has been articulating in public," they said. "Congress believes that reservations are the fundamental right of SC/ST. They can't be left to the government's discretion," they said.

Lok Janshakti Party demanded that the central government restore reservation as provided under the Constitution.

Title: NMC suspends women SHG’s contract in food poisoning case
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Nagpur: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) has suspended mid-day meal (MDM) contract given to women self-help group (SHG) Shagun Mahila Bachat Gat, Ramdaspeth, for 43 schools under it after 32 students of Marotrao Mude High School, Hudkeshwar, fell ill with food poisoning symptoms.

The NMC had given the contract of MDM for the government-aided private school. The civic body is likely to take further action against the SHG after receiving report from Foods and Drug Administration (FDA).

NMC education officer Priti Mishrikotkar issued a letter to the women SHG suspending its contract on Saturday. The same day she also issued a letter to The Akshaya Patra Foundation for suppling mid-day meal to all schools served by the SHG.

“The women SHG supplied MDM — 40kg rice and 20kg barbati curry — to Marotrao Mude High School at 12.30 noon on Friday. Students were served MDM at 2.30pm. Twenty-eight students between 3pm and 3.30pm, and four between 6pm and 7pm complained about loose motion, headache, stomach ache etc. Thirty-two students including 21 boys and 11 girls were immediately examined at a private clinic and then admitted at Government Medical College and Hospital. They are undergoing treatment. All students are stable and likely to be discharged on Monday morning,” Mishrikotkar said in a press release.

Mishrikotkar added FDA took samples of food and water at around 5pm on Friday and yet to submit report.

NMC official told TOI that out of 233 students, only 32 faced problems. “There were no complaints from other schools from where the SHG had supplied the same meal. We have not taken any permanent action against the SHG now and will wait for FDA’s report,” the official said.

Despite directives of home minister Anil Deshmukh on Friday and complaint lodged by RTE activist Shahid Sharif on Saturday, Hudkeshwar police has neither sent the food samples for testing nor took any action.

Senior PI RN Waghmare said, “We have preserved the food samples and will send it for chemical analysis on Monday as the FDA office was closed for weekend. Further decision will be taken after receiving reports from FDA,” he said.

Sharif said, “According to Juvenile Justice Act, it is mandatory on the authorities concerned to take action in such cases within 24 hours. It is a serious lapse on the part of authorities.”

Title: 96,000 white ration cards weeded out, final list today
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Visakhapatnam: In a bid to end diversion and recycling of rice distributed through Public Distribution System ( PDS ), the government has decided to issue rice cards to BPL families.

About 19 lakh ration cards are expected to be weeded out from the existing list. The district administrations are gearing up for the distribution of new rice cards to eligible families.

In Visakhapatnam district, the Andhra Pradesh civil supplies department has eliminated 96,035 white ration cardholders. Nearly 60 per cent of the cards come under Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation (GVMC) limits, according to the officials. A re-survey will be conducted to cross-check the details soon before a final list is announced possibly on Monday.

According to the government, upon a study of the ration scheme in the last six months, it found that nearly 10 lakh cardholders were not drawing ration regularly. Moreover, many ration dealers were found resorting to malpractices by purchasing rice from cardholders and selling the same stock to millers.

“We carried out a survey to identify eligible families for disbursement of rice cards. The old concept of ration card is over now,” said civil supplies minister Kodali Srivenkateswara Rao (Nani).

These cards were eliminated by the government under YSR Navasakam— a scheme to identify beneficiaries of various welfare schemes.

As per the rules, the process is supposed to be completed by Sunday and fresh welfare cards like rice cards and Arogyasri cards will be issued by February 15 so as to make the cards effective from March.

Speaking to TOI, Visakhapatnam joint collector, who is also collector of civil supplies, L Shiva Shankar said, “We have eliminated the white ration cards as part of the government’s steps to issue rice cards under YSR Navasakam scheme. There will be no white ration or pink cards in future. Those who are below poverty line will be given the rice cards.

As part of the Navasakam scheme, surveyors went door-to-door to check the financial status of families and take their consent before eliminating their names from the list of white ration cardholders.

“A total of 96,035 white ration cards have been eliminated so far. We are now carrying out a resurvey. We will announce a final list possibly by Monday,” Shiva Shankar added.

Title: 100-day action plan to help boost Class 10 exam results
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: The district school education department has launched a 100-day action plan to boost the performance of students taking the Class 10 examinations this year. A lot is riding on the exams this year as these are the first class 10 exams after the introduction of several reform measures introduced this year.

Speaking to TOI, Prem Kumar, the deputy district education officer said that the department is organising mock tests at regular intervals to help students identify their weaknesses. “The action plan has been prepared on the basis of instructions from state government officials. Schools are being provided with model papers,” Kumar added.

Several changes were made to the examination pattern in course of the last year. The 20% internal marking system was scrapped and the state government also did away with objective-type questions. The internal marks system was removed after there were allegations of malpractice by some private institutions.

Additionally, the duration of the exam has been increased to 2 hours 45 minutes from the earlier 2 hours 30 minutes. The duration has been increased so that students use the first 10 minutes to develop a comprehensive understanding of the question paper and use the last five minutes to revise their answer script.

Elaborating on the action plan, deputy DEO Kumar said that students have been divided into several categories. “The action plan primarily focuses on slow learners. Tailor-made study material and reference books are being prepared and supplied to schools,” added Kumar.

M Venkata Rao, the Visakhapatnam district president and state treasurer of AP private un-aided school management said that students should note all changes introduced in the exams. “In the absence of objective-type questions, students should focus on concept-oriented learning instead of depending on question banks,” he said.

Nearly 2,100 students are going to take the class 10 examinations within GVMC limits. Officials of the civic body informed that students are being called in for additional study hours in the mornings and evenings.

Title: Haven’t paid fines on e-challans? Traffic cops may seize your bike
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Visakhapatnam: In case you have received more than six e-challans for violating traffic rules and have not bothered to pay the fine , then beware. The next time the city traffic police spot your vehicle on the road , it will be seized.

In a bid to ensure compliance, the traffic cops of the city have formed special teams who have been deputed across the city’s streets to check vehicles and verify if there are any pending e-challans against them. The cops are armed with apps on their smartphones and will seize the vehicle in case there are more than six pending challans issued against it.

Speaking to TOI, M Ramesh Kumar (ADCP traffic) said that fines have been collected for only 30 per cent of the total number of e-challans issued. “Since many traffic violators are delaying payment of fines, we have formed special teams to collect the dues. The city police are yet to receive fines against more than six lakh challans.”

Over 3 lakh e-challans have been issued over the last year. These challans have been issued by identifying rule violators by taking their pictures on phones and using closed-circuit cameras. Once someone is caught violating a traffic rule, the owner of the vehicle receives an e-challan on their phone through an app linked to the road transport authority (RTA) server.

According to ACP (traffic) MRK Raju, many motorists have not provided their phone numbers to the RTA, or have not updated them. Consequently, they do not receive alerts for the e-challans issued against them.

“We appeal to motorists to know about the e-challans pending against them by looking up their vehicle numbers in the e-challan mobile apps and other websites and clear their dues,” added Raju.

City police commissioner RK Meena said that despite the presence of traffic police at junctions, motorists— especially youngsters are violating traffic rules by jumping signals, riding without helmets or riding without documents.

“Our teams are going to nab all those violators who have failed to pay the dues by intercepting vehicles and entering their vehicle numbers in the app,” Meena added.

Police sources said that special teams set up for the job has managed to collect pending fines from over 2,000 motorists per day since the drive began around a week ago.

Title: Jana Sena meet for civic polls
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Jana Sena ’s city unit held a constituency-level meeting at Visakhapatnam East constituency on Sunday. State general secretaries T Siva Sankar, Bolisetti Satyanarayana and member of political affairs committee Kona Tatarao were in attendance. The meeting deliberated upon the party’s preparation for the upcoming municipal elections .

Speaking on the occasion, Satyanarayana asked the party cadre to take an active role in identifying prevailing civic issues .

“The party cadre should take the ideology and policies of the party to the public besides fighting the government’s anti-people measures,” he said. tnn

Title: CITU urges govt to not run private buses in city
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The Centre of Indian Trade Unions (CITU) has urged the state government to not allow private buses to ply in the city. RKVS Kumar, CITU president said that zonal officials of APSRTC and the corporation’s regional manager recently met owners of private buses to operate buses in the city. He said that CITU objects to the move in the interest of poorer sections of society.

Kumar further said that some buses in route number 20A that runs between HB Colony and Old Post Office has been withdrawn. “This is forcing the people to use private transport. The government must run public transport keeping in mind the lessons learnt in New Delhi,” he added.

He added that private services are not only a financial burden on people but are also harmful from the perspective of road safety.

“A bus on road number 10 mowed down two research scholars in front of Andhra University (AU) in 1977, days before they were to be married. That was the last day private buses ran in the city,” he reminded.

Title: Frere Road Overbridge: New Charni Road ROB may be opened by July
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

WR plans to rebuild the ROB before deadline

MUMBAI: After dismantling the girders for British-era Frere Road overbridge , the Western Railway announced on Sunday that it had decided to expedite rebuilding of this ROB and inaugurate it a month before the stipulated deadline of July 16. The primary reason is that the closure of this ROB, situated between Grant Road and Charni Road , has led to numerous traffic snarls in the area.

A senior WR official said, "We got all the paperwork done and the sanctions were in place for all stages of the project before the dismantling work had commenced in January. We have also approved the design for the new girders which are being fabricated at our workshop. Work is on in full swing and we expect the new girders to arrive in a month."

The official admitted the closure of the old ROB had inconvenienced scores of motorists. The WR has informed the BMC to speed up its work on the approach roads to the ROB so that this gets completed simulataneously to avoid delays.

The final bridge will have four lanes with a divider (which was not present in the old structure) to regulate the flow of traffic in both directions. When contacted, WR chief spokesperson Ravinder Bhakar said the dismantling work was a tedious and lengthy process. "Around 220 metric tonnes of steel and a 350sq m slab was removed within just 24 days."

Title: JJS threatens to disrupt V-Day celebrations
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Jana Jagarana Samithi (JJS) on Sunday threatened to disrupt Valentine’s Day celebrations in the city. A group of JJS workers, led by state convener K Vasu, demanded a ban on the lovers’ day celebrations on February 14 and raised slogans ‘Save Bharat culture.’

Releasing posters against V-Day, JJS workers said it was a promotion of western culture. They displayed posters that said ‘say no to V-Day, say no to kisses’ with a picture of a family.

The JJS workers said they would not indulge in moral policing but now allow V-Day celebrations in public places.

The city police, however, said they wouldn’t entertain any kind of moral policing on V-Day.

The police are chalking out plans to deploy force at beaches, parks and a few other public places on V-Day to prevent ‘moral policing’ by right-wing organisations.

Title: British couple takes a pit stop in city as part of all-India drive to raise funds
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

British deputy high commissioner Andrew Fleming (left, in a suit) welcomes Pat and Alan Braithwaite in Visakha... Read More

Visakhapatnam: British couple Pat and Alan Braithwaite were in the city recently as part of a 5,600-km-long Trans-India Challenge. Travelling in their yellow-and-black Morgan three-wheeler Queen Bee, the 34 day journey by the couple from Suffolk will raise funds for the NGO Goonj’s initiative to empower rural communities and contribute to a ‘circular economy’.

The couple departed from Mumbai on February 1, and has since visited Pune, Solapur, Hyderabad, Khammam and Rajamundry and will next head north towards Kolkata.

Queen Bee arrived in the city with around 1,200 km of the road trip complete. The journey, however, was not smooth throughout. The specially-designed suspension on the vehicle was put to test after leaving Khammam and crossing over into Andhra Pradesh, but after running checks on arrival in Rajahmundry, Queen Bee was declared in perfect health to continue to Vizag . Along the way, the car and husband and wife Alan and Pat have been greeted with smiles, waves and requests for selfies. Traffic has often come to a standstill as motorists and pedestrians stopped to photograph Queen Bee.

Alan (73), an entrepreneur, said, “The roads have generally been good and India’s drivers have been very supportive towards us. However, day six threw up some surprises and the road quality, combined with the heat, made it an unexpectedly difficult day. But no one expected this to be easy.”

Adding that cars such as Queen Bee are a rare sight on India’s roads, he said, “I have a deep connection with India. My grandmother is from Mysore and my grandparents were married in Mumbai. My mother is from Belgaum and my parents got married in Shimla. India is very close to my heart and I adore it. This is my third visit to India but this adventurous ride which is the first one makes it more special and meaningful.”

Pat (73) said, “Our drive on the 30-km-long coastal stretch of Visakhapatnam was amazing and we loved the journey. We also had a great experience while interacting with the students of Gitam University.” The couple added that they are partnering with Goonj to raise awareness about the organisation in and outside India and to help fund its projects on the circular economy.

Speaking about the Trans-India Challenge, British deputy high commissioner Andrew Fleming said on a visit to the Port City, “We are glad to welcome Alan Braithwaite to the region. Undertaking this ambitious initiative so soon after a major heart operation is an example to many. There is huge potential to leverage the circular economy to new levels for the benefit of India’s rural communities.”

Title: Hot trial of RINL's forged wheel plant
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Limited ( RINL ), which owns and operates the Visakhapatnam Steel Plant said on Sunday it has launched the hot trial of the forging line at its forged wheel plant in Lalganj in Rae Bareily district of Uttar Pradesh.

Senior RINL officials, including PK Rath, the chairman and managing director, KK Ghosh, director (projects), DK Mohanty, director (commercial) and AK Saxena, director (operations), attended the event, according to an RINL press release.

Laxmi Raman, executive director of the railway board, and senior executives from SMS Germany, which had built the forged the plant, also witnessed the production of first forged wheel from the plant.

RINL has set up the plant at an estimate cost of Rs 1,680 crore. The plant will have a production capacity of 1 lakh wheels per annum, the release said. RINL will be supplying the wheels to the Indian Railways.

Title: Mumbai surgeon conned me: Acid attack survivor
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: A magistrate court recently directed the police to conduct an inquiry and submit a report after a 21-year-old acid attack survivor accused a plastic surgeon from a reputed South Mumbai hospital of cheating her.

The woman alleged that the doctor had taken Rs 2 lakh that she had managed to get through a crowdfunding initiative and refused to return it even when the surgery had not been performed.

The woman said she had refused to undergo the scheduled surgery as the doctor had allowed a film crew to cover it as part of its documentary without obtaining her consent. She also said despite repeated requests, the doctor had refused to return the money.

Advocate Swapana Kode , who submitted the complaint, said, “Since the police was not taking action, we approached the court. The court has now directed officials of the Azad Maidan police station to submit a report. The money was raised through a campaign by an NGO and siphoning it amounts to breach of trust.”

The survivor’s estranged brother-in-law is accused of orchestrating the acid attack on her in 2014.

The survivor told the court when she had visited the doctor with her brother the doctor allegedly threatened them with dire consequences if they visited again. The survivor added it was also brought to her notice that without taking her consent, the doctor had posted her pictures on various social media sites. The survivor’s plea says she continues to remain untreated.

Title: GVMC to prepare 1,713 polling stations; zones IV, V to have 376
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation has identified 1,713 polling stations for the upcoming elections to civic bodies.

While Zone-IV and Zone-V will have the most number of polling stations--376 each while Bheemili zone will have the least number of stations-- 54.

GVMC has identified 17.51 lakh voters in the city--8.79 lakh male and 8.71 lakh female voters--based on the voter lists provided by the State Election Commission. Voters belonging to backward communities form a lion’s share of the electorate--9.3 lakh voters.

GVMC is expected to finalise ward-wise reservations based on the number of voters belonging SC/ST/BC and women’s categories in the next few days. GVMC is currently waiting for guidelines from the government to finalise the reservations.

After the government fixed reservations for various categories in local body elections at 59%, a writ petition was filed against the government that the reservations should be capped at 50%.

If the government continues with the 50% reservations, 27% seats in GVMC will be reserved for the Backward Classes, 15% for the Scheduled Castes and 7.5% for the Scheduled Tribes.

Earlier in January, the government had fixed the number of wards in GVMC at 98. Later, it was also published in the extra-ordinary issue of the Andhra Pradesh Gazette.

Bracing for the elections, GVMC has been repurposing a portion on the third floor near the engineering block of the GVMC office into a new council hall to facilitate council meetings. The civic body is spending Rs 2.5 crore on the new council hall. The new council hall will house 120 members, including 98 corporators, city MLAs, MPs, co-option members, etc. The benches are spread into two rows in the council hall with each bench having a seating capacity of three members.

Title: Gorantla Madhav: Hindupur MP calls for R’seema capital
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Tirupati: Even as opposition parties have come out against the state government’s proposal to shift the capital from Amaravati, YSR Congress (YSRC) Hindupur MP Gorantla Madhav has appealed to the chief minister to consider establishing the capital in the Rayalaseema region.

The MP said decentralised development was necessary to build Andhra Pradesh into a formidable state and appealed to YS Jaganmohan Reddy to consider Rayalaseema as the effects of under-development have impoverished people in the region.

Addressing a press conference in Anantapur district on Sunday, the former-cop-turned politician said Telugu Desam Party (TDP) president N Chandrababu Naidu was trying to mislead people as well as industry on KIA motors relocating its Anantapur plant.

Madhav alleged that the TDP president was behind the fake report that KIA motors was engaging in talks with the Tamil Nadu government in order to move out its manufacturing unit from Anantapur. TDP MPs had also attempted to mislead Parliament on the issue, Madhav said, and added that he had tried to stall the spread of misinformation.

“Despite the Andhra Pradesh government and KIA Motors categorically denying any such development, the former chief minister held a press conference and continued to spread lies that KIA Motors plans to move its plant to Tamil Nadu. Chandrababu Naidu is attempting to defame the government,” the Hindupur MP said.

Stating that the YSRC-led government was working for the welfare and industrial progress of the state, Madhav demanded the TDP chief apologise for claiming KIA Motors would be shifting its plant.

Title: Delhi stalker cop case: Sub-inspector suspected victim was having affair
Content:
(Left-right) Preeti Ahlawat and Deepanshu Rathi

Probe reveals cop planned colleague’s murder for weeks

NEW DELHI: Delhi Police sub-inspector Deepanshu Rathi, who killed his colleague and former girlfriend Preeti Ahlawat before shooting himself on Friday night, had begun obsessively stalking her, suspecting that she was in a relationship with another colleague, police probe reveals.Rathi, 27, and Ahlawat, 26, were batchmates during police training and were set to get married. But Ahlawat called off the wedding in December when Rathi’s possessive attitude and his constant messages took a toll on her, police said. Rathi later accused her of having an affair with a batchmate and began tracking her.Probe revealed that for the last few weeks, Rathi was planning to take revenge.Investigations revealed that Rathi’s name was saved as ‘Wikipedia’ on the woman’s phone. Rathi had recently got to know about Ahlawat’s friendship with another SI of their batch, identified as Rohit Tomar, which was disturbing him. “Tomar and Ahlawat were just friends but this did not go down well with Rathi. He started trailing her and saw the two interacting. So, he started following her even more. Tomar’s name on Ahlawat’s phone was saved as ‘Rays’,” said an officer privy to the investigation said.On Sunday afternoon, Ahlawat’s body was handed over to the family after a post-mortem examination. The preliminary report revealed that she sustained a single gunshot wound and the bullet was stuck in her head. Police had recovered three empty cartridges from the location where she was murdered.Ahlawat’s elder brother reached Delhi from New Zealand on Sunday morning and could not hold back his tears.The WhatsApp group of the 2018 batch where Rathi used to forwarded pictures of Ahlawat walking out of metro stations and moving around, had only male members.Police officers said Rathi and Ahlawat had started dating in June 2019 and the last communication between the two was on January 3 this year. “We have sent her mobile phone for forensic examination to check if any messages or chats have been deleted. She had also blocked him so we need to check if he was trying to contact her through another number. His last messages to her said he wanted to meet her. In other messages, he asked her to leave her job and wanted to know where she was. Ahlawat’s response to his request to meet was a ‘no’,” an officer privy to the investigation said.Ahlawat’s elder sister told police that she decided to call off the wedding as she was sick of his possessive behaviour. Rathi’s family had also tried to counsel him so that he moved on in his life. Both the families had even started looking for other prospects for their children.In Video: Delhi: Woman cop shot dead by her batchmate

Title: Maharashtra cops bust illegal VoIP exchange in Noida, suspect ISI role
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

NOIDA: Two years after six unauthorised internet service providers were busted in Uttar Pradesh as part of a SIM box fraud across NCR, the crime branch of Mumbai police raided a telecom exchange in Noida.

The search was conducted last Thursday after links were found between the Noida telecom exchange and the one in Kerala , from where international calls were being made using VoIP (voice over internet protocol) technology. The VoIP exchanges were being used by callers suspected to be linked to Pakistani spy agency ISI to gather information about important defence installations, PTI reports.

While one person was arrested from Kerala’s Changaramkulam, equipment such as SIM boxes with multiple SIM cards, hard disc, VoIP adapter and some documents were seized from the office in Noida Sector 3.

SIM boxes are used to route VoIP calls made from a foreign location but the number that flashes on the receiver’s phone is Indian. According to officials, the alleged fraud came to light in January, when they received information that a landline number based in Mumbai had received an internet call from Saudi Arabia . However, this call had evaded the local telecom operator and was passed off as an Indian number.

According to defence sources, defence personnel in September last year had received calls seeking information related to important defence installations, PTI reports. The involvement of ISI was suspected, sources said, adding that investigation revealed illegal VoIP exchanges in Noida and Kerala which routed incoming calls from Pakistan to local numbers.

The Mumbai crime branch found as many as 20 IMEI numbers of various service providers were being used from a single device.

Title: Chhattisgarh may follow Uddanam patients’ model
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The Chhattisgarh government is likely to adopt AP’s schemes for kidney patients in its Supebeda region.

A team from Chhattisgarh recently visited Uddanam in Srikakulam district where nearly 13,000 patients from 177 villages are benefitting from the state government’s support system.

Local area hospital superintendent Dr E Lakshminarayana said the Chhattisgarh government had written to the Centre, requesting remedial actions for kidney patients in their state. The Centre then suggested to approach AP.

“The Chhattisgarh team was impressed with with the facilities in Uddanam. The team would submit their report and would soon meet chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy by next month to discuss the issue,” said a senior medical officer. According to the Chhattisgarh team, nearly 100 people died of renal failure in Supebeda in the last 15 years. Supebeda has a population of 1,200 and 300 people suffer from kidney-related ailments. The patients need to travel 230 kms for dialysis. The Chhattisgarh team studied the conditions of patients, the medical support given by the government and interacted with patients, doctors and the staff.

The AP government has provided water facility, set up a super-specialty hospital, pension scheme of Rs 10,000 and a medical team in Uddanam.

Title: AB Venkateswara Rao IPS: AB Venkateswara Rao dismisses charges as lies, explores legal options
Content:
AB Venkateswara Rao

VIJAYAWADA: Former chief of intelligence , AB Venkateswara Rao on Sunday said the allegations levelled against him were false.In a statement, Rao said there was no need to worry over the news of his suspension as it had not disturbed him in any manner. He said he is exploring legal options available to him and everyone will get to know what happens next in due course of time.Before the general elections, Rao had faced allegations of snooping on opposition leaders to help TDP, the ruling party. Following the allegations, the Election Commission of India (ECI) transferred him from the post of additional director general (ADG), intelligence. Though he was made director general (DG) of Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB), after the YSRC government came into power he was transferred without any post seven months ago.TDP MP Kesineni Srinivas tweeted that he did not expect chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy to suspend Rao, instead felicitate him for being responsible for YSRC’s sweeping win and TDP’s debacle in the recent elections.Telugu Desam Party spokesperson Varla Ramaiah, however, said that suspension of Rao was part of vindictive politics by CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy.

Title: Coronavirus: All aboard luxury cruise liner off Hong Kong test negative, allowed to leave
Content:
AP photo

All 3,688 people, including 73 Indians, on board luxury cruise liner World Dream anchored at the Kai Tuk cruise terminal in Hong Kong since Wednesday, were cleared to disembark on Sunday after all samples tested negative for the novel coronavirus (nCoV).Meanwhile, the toll in China’s coronavirus outbreak jumped to 811 on Sunday, surpassing global fatalities (774 deaths) in the 2002-03 SARS epidemic, even as Chinese officials said the cases of infection have started dropping for the first time after weeks of sharp rise.Two more cruise liners remain stranded in Asian waters over coronavirus fears. Six more on board Diamond Princess, anchored at Japan’s Yokohama with 138 Indians, tested positive for the virus on Sunday, taking the total to 69. The other, Westerdam, has been denied port of call in Japan and is sailing southwest off the Taiwan coast.Cruise liner Westerdam has been denied port of call in Japan and “working with different governments” for a resolution. No coronavirus case has been reported so far, Holland America Line , which operates the cruise, said.(With inputs from Saurabh Sinha and agencies)

Title: Mumbai: Depressed rentals, high civic taxes hit luxe flat investors
Content:
Representative image

Massive inventory makes luxe rentals go for discount

MUMBAI: Investors who bought luxury apartments, hoping property prices would appreciate and they would earn fabulous rents, now face a harsh reality. Not only have prices stagnated or dropped, but rental incomes from such flats are low.A glut of high-end apartments, mainly in central Mumbai, has left tenants with a wide choice of properties to choose from. As a result, rents for large apartments have crashed by 20%, and in some cases up to 30% and more.In new buildings, high outgoings and maintenance charges, added with tax on rental income, have left owners with little in hand. A developer cited the example of a Rs 5-crore apartment, which currently fetches a rent of Rs 1 lakh a month. “But after deducting the outgoings and 22% tax on rental income, the owner gets a measly Rs 56,000 in hand. The yield is barely over 1% annually on such an expensive property,” he said.“It’s true. Home owners who have leased big apartments are left with little in hand,” said Pranay Vakil, chairman of Praron Consultancy.To create demand for rental housing, leading developers have set up separate cells within their organisations to cater to leave-and-licence demand for flats bought by their investors. They have even drawn up standard agreements that can be quickly signed by someone who wants to move in quickly, saving on expenses on lawyers.A property broker from central Mumbai said a lot of supply has come into the market in this area, which has also affected the older gated communities. According to him, property prices in the area have come down by 20%.Owners, discouraged from selling, prefer to give a flat on rent. “For a Rs 4-crore apartment in central Mumbai, that earlier would fetch Rs 1.5 lakh a month, today commands a little over a lakh a month—a 33% drop,” he said.The rate of rental return doesn’t change much with area or property type. The broker said a 5BHK flat worth Rs 20 crore in a new project in Worli fetches the owner a monthly rental of Rs 4.5 lakh. “But, after deducting taxes and outgoings, he gets barely Rs 2 lakh in hand a month,” he said.A property consultant operating in the western suburbs said deluxe 4 and 5BHK apartments in Bandra-Khar once commanded rentals of Rs 5-7 lakh a month. These are now down in the region of Rs 3.3 lakh a month. “However, 1-2BHK flats are in demand and their owners are earning good rentals (as a proportion of costs) in Bandra-Khar,” he said.The rental market has been under pressure for the past two or three years, said Pankaj Kapoor of Liases Foras, a real estate data and analytics firm. “Rental supply has increased and a huge inventory is available, but bigger flats are going at a discounted rate,” he said. From Lower Parel to Bandra, large flats are lying empty and owners are compelled to rent them out at cheaper rates, said Kapoor.Ritesh Mehta, senior director and head of residential services (development initiatives) at JLL India, said the residential leasing market in Mumbai has predominantly remained stagnant for two years at most locations.“A few exceptions have been locations closer to work and commercial hubs: BKC, Goregaon, Lower Parel and Airoli have seen escalation of rentals by 3-5% year on year. Average rentals in Mumbai have been 1.7-2% of the capital value of a property.”While owners rue investing in what has turned out to be a bad rental market for them, the situation couldn’t possibly be better for tenants. In this zero-sum game, the rentier’s loss is the renter’s gain.

Title: Jawan held for shooting cabbie who refused to take e-payment
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

BAREILLY: A week after a Lucknow-based Ola cab driver was found shot dead near Shahjahanpur city, police arrested a CRPF jawan in Shahjahanpur on Sunday. The accused, identified as Adityapal who is posted with 237 Battalion of CRPF in Pinjore, Haryana , shot the driver with his licenced pistol after the latter refused to accept money through online transaction and asked the accused to pay in cash. Adityapal had booked the cab in Lucknow through the app. The jawan has been arrested and sent to jail on Sunday.

According to police, Vinay Shukla was found dead inside his sedan on the outskirts of Shahjahanpur on February 2. Shahjahanpur SSP Shivasimpi Channappa deployed a crime branch team which found that CRPF jawan Adityapal had booked the cab and when his call detail records were checked, it was evident that Adityapal was with Vinay till the site of the incident. Adityapal was also found to be missing from his house.

Channappa told TOI, “We have recovered the murder weapon. The accused had booked the cab from Lucknow to Barabanki and later from Barabanki to Shahjahanpur. He had promised to pay Rs 2,700 for dropping him to Shahjahanpur from Barabanki and had paid Rs 1,500 before the completion of the journey.”

“Upon reaching, Adityapal offered to pay money online but Vinay asked for cash. They had an argument and Adityapal, in a fit of rage shot Vinay dead with his licenced pistol,” the SSP said.

Title: DGCA exempts air crew from breath analyser tests in Kerala
Content: NEW DELHI: Pilots and cabin crew have been exempted from breath analyser (BA) tests at Kerala ’s main airports in wake of the spreading coronavirus epidemic. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has exempted the crew from BA tests for 15 days at Kannur, Kochi , Kozhikode and Thiruvananthapuram airports with immediate effect. Crew operating flights out of these airports will need to mandatorily undergo post-flight BA at the next immediate station.A DGCA official said this step was taken due to fears of coronavirus. All pilots are mandatorily required to undergo pre-flight BA while operating domestic routes. On international flights, where liquor is served, crew is subject to post-flight BA tests on a random basis.India has so far seen three confirmed cases of coronavirus from Kerala. All three are students who had returned home from Wuhan.

Title: Thane Metro: Internal Metro for Thane may be scrapped
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Representative image

THANE: A project of the metro rail network meant internally for Thane city has possibly been scrapped, said a senior official of the Thane civic body. The metro project is likely to be replaced by a high-speed tram, also known as light urban rail transit system.

The high-speed tram runs at a speed of 60 km per hour as against the old trams which trundle along at 15 km an hour.

“The reason that this decision has been taken is that the high-speed tram entails less capital expenditure as compared to the metro rail, said the official.

Last year, the Centre asked the state to rework the metro plan.

Title: Oscars 2020 Red Carpet: Director Spike Lee pays tribute to Kobe Bryant, wears Lakers-colored tuxedo
Content: Oscar-winner, Spike Lee paid a fashion tribute to late basketball star Kobe Bryant The director, who has never fallen short of making fashion statements on the red carpet, had all eyes on him when he arrived in a purple Lakers-coloured tuxedo with wife Tonya Lewis Lee . He paired his outfit with a white shirt, black bow tie and orange Nike trainers.Wearing a coat with the number 24 on his back and on either side of the lapel, he fondly remembered the NBA star who passed away in a tragic helicopter accident early this month.Spike documented Bryant in the 2009 documentary‘Kobe Doin' Work’.Kobe Bryant, who is expected to be part of the Academy’s “In Memoriam” segment, is also an Oscar winner. He took home the golden statue for the short film ‘Dear Basketball’.This is not the first time that the director has paid a fashion tribute to late icons. Last year, the filmmaker wore an all-purple suit and gold Prince symbol necklace in honour of the legendary musician. That night, he went on to win his first Oscar in the Best Original Screenplay category for ‘Blackkklansman’.

Title: Centre to auction 1st batch of ‘enemy properties’ in Bengal
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

KOLKATA: The office of enemy properties in Bengal — the custodian of 2,764 properties in the state — has started making a list of properties free of legal encumbrances, so that the first lot could be put up for sale.

“Enemy properties” are defined as those left behind by people who migrated to Pakistan (after the 1965 and 1971 wars) and China (following the Sino-Indian war of 1962), to take citizenship of those countries.

In 2017, the Centre amended the Enemy Property Act, 1968, and Public Premises (Eviction of Unauthorised Occupants) Act, 1971. It was decided that heirs of those who left India after 1962, 1965, and 1971 cannot claim ownership of these (enemy) properties.

Late last month, Union home minister Amit Shah set up a panel to auction more than 9,400 enemy properties across India, which is likely to fetch around Rs 1 lakh crore to the exchequer.

Following this, the Custodian of Enemy Property for India started working on a pilot auction in Bengal to assess the nature of the properties to be auctioned and prepare a legal report before the first lot is put up for sale.

Last year, the Centre allowed state governments to use some enemy properties for public utilities.

“The first step in the pilot project is to free up a property and to divest it under Section 18 of the Enemy Property Act,” an official with the Custodian of Enemy Property for India said.

“One wing of the department is busy making the properties free of encumbrances,” he said.

As of now, most enemy properties in Bengal are rented out to corporates or individuals, with the custodian office collecting rent. Maintenance of the properties is sometimes challenging, as the tenant cannot change the nature of the property.

“A large chunk of these properties is in districts like Malda and Murshidabad. There are certain iconic buildings in Kolkata, too, that are used for commercial purposes,” the official said.

Title: TMC returns guv’s ‘poll violence’ fire
Content:
This story is from February 10, 2020

Kolkata: The West Bengal governor on Sunday once again expressed his anguish over the law and order situation in the state. How can there be free and non-violent polls when explosives are being traded freely in the state, Jagdeep Dhankhar told reporters in the city.

Bengal is well-known for its culture, music and scholars and has the highest number of Nobel laureates in the country, but how can it also be a “hub of violence”, he said.

“Blasts can be anywhere in Bengal. My heart aches as it causes loss to people. We have to focus on it,” Dhankhar said.

Rebutting the charge, Trinamool Congress secretary general Partha Chatterjee said Dhankhar should have continued as a politician for a longer period instead of becoming Bengal governor. “Now, we do not have to give rejoinders to political leaders such as Dilip Ghosh; instead, we have to reply to Raj Bhavan,” Chatterjee said.

Chatterjee, the state parliamentary affairs minister, also criticised BJP Bengal president Ghosh for saying on social media that on Sunday he visited the Tirupati Balaji temple and prayed for the state’s prosperity, peace and ‘parivartan’.

Ghosh should first visit temples of Bengal, Chatterjee said and added that “people of Bengal have faith in Mamata Banerjee”.

Content:

Aerial view of Kolkata

KOLKATA: The office of enemy properties in Bengal — the custodian of 2,764 properties in the state — has started making a list of properties free of legal hassle so that the first lot could be put up for sale.

‘Enemy properties’ are defined as those left behind by people who left to take citizenship of Pakistan (after the 1965 and 1971 wars) and China (following the Sino-Indian war of 1962). In 2017, the government amended the Enemy Property Act, 1968 and Public Premises (Eviction of Unauthorised Occupants) Act, 1971. It was decided that the heirs of those who left India after 1962, 1965 and 1971 could no longer claim ownership of the enemy properties.

Late last month, home minister Amit Shah set up a panel to auction more than 9,400 enemy properties across India, which is likely to fetch around Rs 1 lakh crore to the exchequer. Following that, the Custodian of Enemy Property of India started working on a pilot auction in Bengal to assess the nature of the properties to be auctioned and prepare a legal report before the first lot is put up for sale.

Last year, the Centre allowed state governments to utilise some enemy properties for public use.

“The first step in the pilot project is to free up a property and to divest it under Section 18 of the Enemy Property Act,” said an official with the Custodian of Enemy Property of India. “One wing of the department is busy making the properties free of legal hassles.”

Last year, the government sold Wipro’s enemy shares worth Rs 1,150 crore to insurers like LIC, GIC and The New India Assurance Corporation.

Title: Valentine's Week: Happy Teddy Day 2020: Images, Quotes, Wishes, Greetings, Messages, Cards, Pictures, GIFs and Wallpapers
Content: With Valentine’s Day just around the corner, celebrations for the much-awaited day are going on in full swing. Lovers are all set to express their love for their special ones with mushy gifts. Like any other day of the Valentine’s Week, Teddy Day is celebrated with much enthusiasm and it is always celebrated on February 10. On this day, loved ones give each other a fluffy teddy bear to make one another feel special and content. Moreover, a teddy bear is a sign of cuteness, happiness, and is a perfect gift. Gifting a cuddly bear to the special one is never a bad idea. It is rather a perfect way to communicate your true feelings for it connotes a special meaning. It’s a gesture to assure your special one that you’ll always be there by their side as a true companion just like a teddy bear. This soft toy never fails to spread charm and creates a perfect romantic environment.No matter how old you grow, it’s never too late to celebrate Teddy Day. Especially for every girl, a lot of sweet memories are attached to this soft toy from childhood. The huggable companion can bring an instant smile and cheer people up. Therefore, this Teddy Day choose the best Teddy for your beloved available in various hues and celebrate all the moments of your relationship making the day a memorable one. In case, you are thinking that it’s just for girls, you need to rethink. Who doesn’t need a hug and it’s hard to say no to an adorable bear. The cute teddy bears are available in various sizes and vivid colours but you can always go ahead with the colour of his or her choice. Make sure you pick the right kind of a fluffy bear to communicate your true feelings to the special one along with a sweet handwritten note scribbled especially for them because wishes and messages play a significant role in sprucing up the vibes of that particular day celebration.To make your day a little more special, we have compiled a list of lovely teddy day wishes, quotes, and messages with heart-tugging teddy day images and wallpapers.I want to be with you forever and I love you more every passing moment. Today, I just want to hug and say Happy Teddy Day my love.A cute teddy bear to my cutest one on a cute occasion. Wish you a Happy Teddy Bear Day sweetheart!Like teddy bears are mushy and adorable, my girlfriend is also loving and cute. Wish you a Happy Teddy Day my love!Your relationship with me is as soft as a teddy bear furs, as cute as a teddy bear face, and as loving as an entire teddy bear. Wish you a Happy Teddy Day my darling!When everyone else has let you down, there’s always Ted. I am thinking of someone cute and huggable, who is you. Wish you a very Happy Teddy Day, my love.I may not be there for you to hug and wish a happy teddy day. However, I am sending a cute teddy bear that will remind you of me all the time. Wish you a very Happy Teddy Day sweetheart!“A bear remains a bear – even when most of him has fallen off or worn away.” – Charlotte Gray“You don’t have to be young to find a friend in a teddy bear.” – Rachel Newman“A bear teaches us that if the heart is true, it doesn’t matter much if an ear drops off.” – Helen Exley“In a world where everyone seems to be larger and louder than yourself, it is very comforting to have a small, quiet companion.” – Peter Gray“A teddy bear is your childhood wrapped up in faded yellow fur, and as such, he commands affection long after he is outgrown.” – Pam Brown

Title: Coronavirus in Kolkata: Howrah woman sent to hospital for quarantine
Content:
Representative image

KOLKATA: A 23-year-old woman, who arrived at Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport from Bangkok on Sunday, was sent to hospital for quarantine and observation after thermal screening at the airport detected fever.The Howrah resident became the first passenger to be sent from the Kolkata airport since the novel coronavirus scare began.She had gone to Thailand on vacation as a part of a group, and had a temperature of 99.5 °F. She is now under observation at the Beliaghata ID hospital. Officials said she didn’t have any history of travel to China, clarifying it was a “routine procedure”.

Title: MNS takes out massive march, vows ‘eye-for-an-eye’ reply to anti-CAA rallies
Content:
PTI photo

MUMBAI: Extending his support to the Citizenship Amendment Act, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray on Sunday warned of giving a ‘befitting eye-for-aneye reply’ to rallies being held against the new law. Along with Pakistani and Bangladeshi infiltrators, Thackeray added illegal Nigerians to his ‘hit list’. The MNS chief, however, opposed the proposed National Register of Citizens.On Sunday afternoon, the MNS workers—many in saffron t-shirts, waving the party flags and shouting slogans like ‘Bharatmata Ki Jai’, ‘Jai Shri Ram’, and ‘Vande Mataram’ —took out a huge march from Marine Drive near Hindu Gymkhana which culminated at Azad Maidan , where Thackeray demanded the eviction of illegal Pakistani, Bangladeshi and Nigerian infiltrators from the country. Before joining the march at Marine Drive, Thackeray sought blessings at Siddhivinayak temple in Prabhadevi, while party leaders Amey Khopkar, Sandeep Deshpande, Santosh Dhuri performed an aarti at the nearby Ram Mandir.Deputy commissioner of police Pranay Ashok said around 20,000 activists participated in the march. He added that 3,000-4,000 police officials were deployed to control the crowd and CCTV and drone cameras were used to manage the crowd. According to political experts, the rally was a show of strength and to make people aware of the party’s new saffron flag bearing the royal seal of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, that was launched on January 23.Addressing the rally, Thackeray said: “Bangladeshi and Pakistani infiltrators must be deported from India. Now, Nigerians have also been added to the list...Pakistani and Bangladeshi infiltrators’ pockets have been mushrooming everywhere.”In Video: Pro-NRC rally: Will drive 'infiltrators' out of India, says MNS chief
